description:
Eaten here a couple times for the lunch buffet and I often find myself craving their food and excited to go back! There is great variety and everything I've tried is delicious! Also the naan is the best I've had it has the perfect doughiness I like. I read reviews how the service was bad, but the servers were extremely attentive and always filling water up! 

I also think the restaurant is beautifully decorated with pretty murals. Would recommend and will be back!
author: Hoku L.

description:
I used to come here every once in awhile and really like the food here so I was really looking forward to it since I had not been there for two years. But it was just a awful experience.

 The three of us went for the lunch buffet and the waiter was really rude. It was pretty empty in there so there wasn't a lot of people to deal with. 4 whatever reason he did not want to give my friend sugar for her chai tea. He argued with her that she didn't need it and after asking for the third time finally gave her some sugar. He then got upset cuz we put dirty plates in the table next to us because we had no room to put them he never came by to pick up the dirty plates in the first place. We came to have lunch not deal with someone's rudeness and bad attitude.

I asked to speak to the manager more leaving but I can only talk to another of the employees he was really nice but we won't be going back.
author: Henry Y.

description:
Dissapointing..... we were there for an early dinner . Service was the poorest i ever experienced . We thought it will be a good idea since we are in the neighborhood. We ordered veggie samosas ,1 stella , coconut veggie  curry and a lamb entree.

The samosas were  dry . We have to remind the waiter we need the beer after were halfway with our samosas.

The lamb is so tough and you can tell its been sitting in their kitchen cause its dark dark brown when i bit the meat and expose the inner part .

And guess what ? i have to keep waving to get the waiters attention for more water. And to make it worst
It wasn't busy there were only 4 guest total including me and my husband.

Maybe we got there at the wrong time cause it was a slow day and they were probably  microwaving left over.

Forgive me if i was wrong!
Never again!
author: Blessie F.

description: This review is for their dinner. This place is surprisingly underrated. My family and I found the service to be very attentive. We got the chicken tikki masala, chicken vindaloo, lamb chop (which was actually rack of lamb). Plus lots of their naan. Everything was flavorful, tender, and cooked with care. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for good Indian cuisine on budget.
author: mscharity Y.

description:
I wanted to impress her, so I bought out the whole place for the night for just the two of us.

Nah, we showed up like an hour and a half before close on a Sunday and were literally the only customers the entire time.

(-_^) HYRULEDRABADI LINK CHICKEN
Apricots & straw fries, meat kinda tough but tasty. #twss

(-_^) GANONGOAT CHEESE NAAN
Couldn't taste the cheese nbd.

I chose this place because vegetarian options for her + open late on Sundays. Deece, I'd go back.
author: Dan B.

description: Great food, and good service. The restaurant is big and clean with Indian music you will feel that you are in india
author: Hashem F.

description:
Every Sunday we get a tika masala from here and it's always amazing! Can't say enough praises about this Indian. Great people working her always very friendly .

From your favourite irish customers! :)
author: Cian G.

description:
This restaurant is walking distance so I come here a lot.   There are 2 Indian restaurants near me but this is the best bc the atmosphere is better than the other one.   I love the ambiance because it has a lot of light through the ceiling to floor windows.   The Indian art on the walls are nice and not decorated tacky.  It is very clean.   I ate the buffet many times and it has a good selection of both vegetarian and non vegetarian.    I'm Indian so I've eaten Indian food all my life.   The buffet food are displayed beautifully.   Nan is brought to your table fresh.   
The servers, Rajat, Ravi & Onkar are very cool and friendly.      It is a great place to bring a date, family, friends and various occasions.
author: Sandhya V.

description: All I can say is I've seen the food quality here decline over the last 4 years. My recent delivery was simply terrible. The Naan was old and stale, the chicken was over cooked and dry, and the garbanzo  bean dish was inedible.
author: Erica C.

description:
I've been disappointed by the Indian buffets in San Francisco thus far, so when my friend suggested hitting up one after our urban hike, I braced myself for more of the same. I was pleasantly surprised by the weekend lunch buffet at India Clay Oven, and while it's not my Favorite Indian Restaurant (Union City shoutout), it'll do in a pinch when I'm craving Indian in the city.

Rating Breakdown:
1.5/2 Stars for Taste --
I always judge a buffet by the classics -- tikka masala and saag. India Clay Oven nails it in both respects. Be warned, the saag paneer has a bit of a kick! I also really enjoyed the tandoori chicken, which was by far some of the moistest I have tried. I regretted not trying some until the end when I was already fit to burst. The naan was served hot and not overly bready or hard like some other places. It had almost the elastic texture of a green onion pancake, which I really enjoyed. I was not thrilled with the kheer, it tasted more like vanilla than cardamom...but how mad can you be at creamy sweetness? The fish pakora was more fried bits than fish. The peas in the mixed vegetables dish tasted almost like they had been previously frozen (the cauliflower was good though!).

0.5/1 Stars for Value --
Before tip, it was about $13 per person. There isn't a huge array of options, but all the basics are covered (two types of pakora, tandoori chicken, three types of curry, two types of dessert). My only complaint is that there wasn't complimentary chai. 

1/1 Stars for Customer Service --
Our server came by constantly to fill our waters. We ate too quickly for him to take our plates though because we would just stack them and continue eating like savages.

Bonus star because this is currently my favorite Indian buffet in the city and I'd come back when the cravings hit.
author: Abby W.

description:
This place gives me and my son VIP treatment every time we walk through the door.  I would recommend the lunch time buffet that is affordable and has a great variety of Indian dishes.  My favorites are the chicken makhni which is sliced perfectly and the vegetable pakora.  Both are just yum.  The service is great too, the wait staff is always refilling your water or bringing you hot piping nan from the kitchen.

Do yourself a favor and try this place!
author: Mariam A.

description:
Buffet was a deal for $13 per person. The food was super fresh and flavorful! Pictures are worth a thousand words, so see below pics. They definitely didn't skimp on the ingredients or the meat. And the interior was impressive, classy. 

Will be back.
author: J P.

description: My first experience here was not perfect, but the owner contacted me and made things right. The food was very good this time around.
author: Chris F.

description:
It was quiet and not busy when we came in, so we were seated quick and our order taken pretty quickly. There was a lunch buffet available and while we skimmed over the options, we decided to go with something off the menu, as we had our preferences.

We had an order of paneer tikka masala, tandoori chicken, and a side of garlic naan, the typical order we like to get when trying out a new Indian restaurant so we can gauge it to our favourite. The masala sauce was good and not overly spicy (how I prefer it) and the portion sizes were just right. My partner found the chicken really well done and our garlic naan also great. 

Prices were really good for the portion sizes. 

If you're in the area and looking for Indian instead of Chinese cuisine, you can't go wrong stopping in here.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Underrated. My favorite Indian lunch buffet in town, and incredibly it's available on the weekends. 
Much better than Great India or Star India nearby, probably better than Amber downtown and without having to pay for the mimosas.
author: Kevin M.

description: My favorite restaurant in the area. Amazing food, good price, and nice atmosphere. A go to for dinners on the weekend.
author: Saiya Y.

description:
I am underwhelmed. Ordered Tandoori chicken and Paneer with Daal. 

Chicken was wrong color (not red at all) not marinated in yogurt very long and like warm. At least the hot plate it was served on was hot but perhaps the food should be as well.

Too much garlic in the green stuff.

Chutneys and lassi were fine. As was the rice. There are really good Indian restaurants to explore, I'll be visiting them before I try this place again. Not the worst food I've had, it's just not very good Indian food.
author: Scott B.

description:
I decided to order for pick up while out running errands. I ordered the saag paneer, chicken mahkni and aloo mattar and the onion naan. 
The food was good--the saag and the chicken dishes were flavorful and didn't leave me feeling greasy and gross. The aloo mattar was "meh", it was bland but I did like that they used fresh peas.
I can't say anything regarding service or ambiance since I was taking it to go, but I was disappointed when I got home to find that they didn't give me any rice! 
When I've ordered Indian food at other restaurants, they always include a side of rice. I wasn't sure if you had to order rice separately but I was shocked not to have even a little tub seeing that I spent $50 for food.
Thankfully the onion naan saved the day so I could enjoy my meal.
So buyer beware--make sure to ask for rice!
author: Kathy K.

description:
First time, very good. Went early, so staff was very attentive. Veggie samosas app are heaven. Chicken masala is yummy, Kashmiri naan is excellent.

We'll be back!
author: Kim G.

description:
Had lunch here after a movie with a companion. The entryway is very pretty, and the inside of the restaurant has ceiling-to-floor glass walls, making for potentially romantic lighting during the evening. Plus they add little candles to the table during the later hours! Too bad we went during daylight - even in the afternoon it's a beautiful date location.

Anyways. Past the decor. Place was fairly empty when we walked in, so we weren't sure what to expect, but our food all came in delicious. First came the vegetable samosas and garlic nan, both of which were crisp and well-seasoned. Potatoes inside the samosas were salt-and-buttery, a contrast to the sweetness and firmness of the peas, and wonderful with or without the sharp sauce provided to eat it with. (There's two that you're given - a sweet, darker sauce, almost syrupy, and a hot green dip. Both are lovely.)

Then the entrees. I ordered the Punjabi lamb curry (requested extra spicy) and my companion the aloo matter with an additional side of jasmine rice. Rice was a little dry, but otherwise fine. The curry - which the waiter put on the table with a rather concerned look - was a pleasant burn, spicy enough to enflame my otherwise heat-tolerant mouth and put a warm ache in my stomach. Word of warning: I do love spicy food, so for the uninitiated please proceed with caution if you want to go with my recommendation.

For the $14 or so I spent on it the proportion of lamb to sauce was staggering! Very generous with the meat, and properly cooked as well, both of which are two strong bonuses in my book. My companion reported that her food was delicious as well, but I wasn't able to get a detailed report from her. I trust her judgement, though.

Taking off a star only because the waiter was nearly silent. Not unwelcoming or unfriendly, just a bit off-putting. I'm not asking for Chik-Fil-A levels of friendliness, but even a "hello, how's your evening going" or "how was the food" would've sufficed. The difference between restaurant dining and takeout, after all, lies primarily in service and atmosphere.

Other than that, food was great, well-spiced. Order the samosas (they're delicious) and come during the evening for a more intimate experience.
author: Nin K.

description:
This place is amazing!!! LOVED I ate here -- the okra was the exact spiciness, heartiness, and savoriness that I always look for. There's a special "okra spot" that I have -- it's a mix of the need full-bodied, comfort-level food and the knowledge that I should be healthy -- and this dish nailed that hankering.  I agree with fellow reviewer Rebecca R -- this place is the real deal. 

The restaurant staff were also incredibly polite and welcoming. Our party of 6 got quite noisy and rowdy (we were excited about an event later that evening), but the staff never expressed their frustration with us which was great. I would absolutely love to come back here on another empty stomach and enjoy another round of bhindi baji. Yum!
author: Julia Y.

description:
I grab food to go at this place, chicken tiki masala with rise. 
Food was great . Promise in 20 min , was there in time .
Don't know about their stuff and service .
Quality of food and time 5 stars. 
Next time will order something else
author: Askhat E.

description:
My favorite Indian spot in the western part of the City.

Really good Indian food with great portions and cheap sizes. Good meat and veggie options. 

We ordered chicken masala, lamb korma, bhindi, naan, pratha, and pallock paneer everything was great.

A second time my gf and I went for the lunch buffet and it was also solid as well. 

Really happy there is a great Indian restaurant walking distance from my house.
author: Ken B.

description:
This is one of our favorite places to eat! The food is seasoned perfectly, the service (both in restaurant and for delivery) is always super speedy, and they are consistent! 

My favorites: Chicken Tikka Masala, Alloo Gobi (careful it's spicy!) and the Saag Paneer.
author: Ashley H.

description:
Great lunch buffet here. The food, ambiance, and service were all fantastic. 

Inside is a beautiful interior. It felt rather regal and was very clean. The food isn't in standard buffet tables or food warmers, but rather, beautiful copper kettles, and there's a pretty good selection. Everything seemed fresh and at a good temperature. 

We came with a large party and they were quick to clear our plates when needed. We really enjoyed our experience.
author: Susan G.

description: I hope that we just caught them on an off night, but our experience was atrocious. Despite having a reservation, there was no one at the front desk when we arrived and we had to go find someone to seat us. It then took at least five minutes to get a server. All five of felt that this was the worst Indian food and service that we've ever had. The restaurant was empty in the middle of dinner time, so maybe it was a sign that others felt the same.
author: Michael C.

description:
I don't often leave reviews, but MAN, this place has gone to hell in a hand basket. It used to be a great lunch buffet place and after not having been in several months, we went today. First off, the creepy factor is at an all time high. Three or four waiters gathered about and just watched us walk in, making us feel as though we interrupted some murder-for-hire plan. We sat down and the waiter poured water in our glasses, (filling one up only a quarter of the way and not returning. We'd asked for iced tea as we sat down so had to get up and ask him for tea and more water. 

When we got up for seconds, the creepiest of waiters followed us and watched every move we made. Then when I was finally going up to get my favorite - the rice pudding dessert, it was no longer there, and in it's place was a big cardboard tub of freezer-burned ice cream. I asked about it and he said, "We don't have rice pudding". I wanted to say, "Listen here, mother f'er, I saw it with my own two eyes!", but instead I just left him a 10% tip. It was really a weird vibe and the worst service we have had...oh yeah! The guy was also talking on his cell phone while pouring someone else's water. We got a good chuckle out of that one. 

Bottom line, unless you want to eat at a place that feels like the abandoned restaurant in Goonies, you're better going elsewhere.
author: Ann S.

description: Went there twice. Didn't enjoy very much. Only go if you've no options to eat around. I'll start with ambiance. Lighting and sitting is very nice, you might enjoy there but place itself is not very clean. I saw multiple bugs walking around my table multiple times. About service, manager on duty wasn't very responsive to me. May be because I went there very late and he may be busy with accounting and stuff, but that's not good. Food taste was also average, arrived on time. Overall, A-OK place.
author: Maulik S.

description:
I love this place, great service each time I step foot into this establishment.  Their food is also delicious.

I love their lunch buffet, they are generous with what they offer and continuously offer to get you a new plate or refills your water.  Another favorite is their fresh nan, it's so warm and fresh that It just adds to the experience.  Highly recommend this place, it's a gem in the Richmond District.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Ordered pick up. Chicken tikki masala and garlic naan. I will say that the chicken was more tender than most Indian places I frequent, but the sauce seemed overly greasy. The naan was a huge disappointment. It was $4.95 and incredibly small, flat, greasy and cold. Some parts were so cold that I wonder if it came right out of the freezer and dropped into oil that was not hot enough( that would explain why it was SOSOSO greasy.)

I hate to leave a bad review, but the naan was big enough of a turn off for me to order else wear next time.
author: Chloe K.

description: This place is awesome. Rajat and omkar are the best!!! Great service and the food was incredible! Best Indian food in SF
author: Christopher G.

description: We've been here a few times and have to say the space, food, and service are great. The atmosphere is casual and the menu features well-made Indian fare plus a good selection of drinks. The best part is that the layout of the restaurant leaves more than enough space for seating, and waiting for a table has never been a pain.
author: Christine T.

description: This is one of the best deals in town if you go for the lunch buffet. And not just because it's a buffet. The food is really well prepared and tasty, and a huge number of dishes available. And it's a white tablecloth and silverware service in a room that's a glass atrium! One of my favorites.
author: Anthony B.

description: Eaten here for first time today... really yummy food... humble staff.. must go for good Indian food
author: Bianca G.

description:
Ordered delivery here twice last week.  Great food and FAST delivery.  Choices of desired spiciness is a plus too.  I used to be able to tolerate very spicy food, but lately the mild and medium are easier to take. 

Saag Paneer and the vegetable curry are awesome...
author: Derek C.

description:
Just got a cheese naan to go. First of all, the price was higher, than the price that they have online. Secondly, there was no cheese in the cheese naan at all. 
This is enough for me not to come back.
author: Sam S.

description: I would give this restaurant a four-star review​ if the service was better today. A friend​ suggested the place and mentioned that the lunch buffet was a good choice. Indeed​ the food was delicious, but the waiters were not very passionate about serving​ guests. I would go back there and I will ignore​ the waiters...;-)
author: Michelle C.

description: Came here for the buffet. Went to dish out the goat curry n there was only gravy. Asked the staff to refill it. They came back n said it was refilled. So went to get some n all I got was shreds of meat n still more gravy. Come on guys, the buffet on fillmore has goat curry n it is in chunks. Nothing to rave about this buffet. Wouldn't waste my $13 here again.
author: Juan B.

description:
I'm constantly surprised with how the food from India Clay Oven exceeds my expectations. I came in the evening and ordered a hefty meal consisting of tandoori chicken, tikka masala, saag paneer, garlic naan, and cucumber salad.

The tandoori chicken came out scalding hot on a skillet fresh from the kitchen. It was succulent, seasoned perfectly and made my mouth water.

The tikka masala likewise was tender and juicy and quickly disappeared along with my rice.

Saag paneer is a personal favorite of mine and India Clay Oven's saag paneer did not disappoint. The cheese and spinach were creamily melted together and complemented each other beautifully.

My only gripes (which are not enough to render my review a 4-star) are the cucumber salad and the service. First, the cucumber salad wasn't so much a salad as much as it was cucumbers and tomatoes in a yogurt dressing. Minimalistic would be a generous use of the word to describe the salad. Regardless, the salad is enjoyable. Second, the service was quite slow, it took our server a good deal of time to get to us, and the place was hardly busy. An additional server didn't speak any English, and while it didn't present any major problems for me, I could see it being a problem for more complex orders or requests.

All-in-all, I always look forward coming to India Clay Oven; the decor is lovely and the food is delicious!
author: George K.

description: Best food ....awesome service  ...food is authetinc ... true indian food must come back
author: Praneshdra S.

description: It's really rich food, very delicious and spicy. Probably the closest to real Indian food that I'll ever taste. (Gracie, age 9)
author: Laura W.

description:
I have been eating here for 15yrs+, and am sorry to report that the quality of the service and food have declined.  Even when no one else is in the dining room, the service is poor.  At my last meal, the chicken tikka kabob, in particular, was a real miss.

It feels like the place, which I love having in the neighborhood, is a bit rudderless.  I hope that management regains focus and brings it back to its former excellence.
author: C. J. W.

description:
The food here is always consistently good! We tried a different place awhile back because of the safety ratings here, and it was even more terrible, so we came back. We always order the cherry and coconut nan, rice, mango lassi and then we always switch up our entrees! The delivery is pretty quick, although the prices are high once you order everything.
All in all we love this place and will be ordered again for sure!
author: Larissa S.

description: This place is so delicious. I was hesitant to try this place at first because of the reviews but several people have recommended this place to me. I am so glad I decided to try it because the food is amazing. It has become my new favorite place for Indian cuisine here in the city. I usually order take out but I have eaten at their lunch buffet once which was yummy as well. But takeout dinner here is the way to go. I always make it a point to bring my boyfriend here when he comes to visit. For sure a must try.
author: Melissa A.

description: Delicious Indian food. Nice atmosphere. Nicely presented. We were here on a Sunday night and it was dead. But the phone rang non stop for take out and delivery orders. The dining room was lovely and the service was great, people should give sit down service a try!
author: Katie P.

description:
I had a bad experience for dinner here. 
To start off, I tried to call up ahead to reserve the table but the gentleman on the other end wasnt able to speak up/speak well. So that led to some confusion and nervousness, especially hosting a dinner for family form out of town.
The restaurant itself has decent interiors, but the food was terrible. 
We were eager to order food and over ordered some of the kababs. The staff should have given suggestions based on number of people or even repeated the order.
The food wasn't good. The paneer pakora was inedible for me :( Kababs were OK - chicken was good, shish kabab wasnt.
The main course was also uninteresting, chicken curry was decent. Naan/roti was undercooked. 

Not recommended.
author: Arjan N.

description: Loved this tucked away place. Good food, lovely space. I have been coming here for the last ten years or so. Always a nice experience.
author: Sunshine H.

description: Rajat is of the best servers there. He is friendly, sweet and very understanding. Food was excellent and service was beyond implacable. Must recommended.!! Amazing people and great food :)
author: Drakzin W.

description: The ayce lunch was ok.  The naan is fresh from the kitchen but it stiffens when it cools.  The rice and salad went well with the lamb and all the sauces.   My favorite was the light yellow sauce with veggies.  It had shaved almonds which made a crunchy bite.  Skip the fried fish and veggies,  very bready and salty.  No free chai.  Mateer was good. Chicken was tender.
author: Helen L.

description: Lovely Tikka Masala and garlic naan not to mention the friendly and attentive wait staff!
author: James B.

description: I love this place and have been coming here for years. The ambiance is pleasant and spacious. The food is better than some of the other Indian restaurants I tried. I think this place is underrated.
author: Marina K.

description: The food here is awesome.  The atmosphere is great and the owners really care about their clientele.  Samosas are bomb, chicken biryani is great, come here and enjoy a great evening!
author: Dan B.

description:
Tasty food. Waiters were sort of nonchalant, but attentive and food came out timely. 
All food comes a la carte.
author: Emily C.

description: They have a great deal. $26 for breakfast for two. It's all you can eat. Food is delicious and service is remarkable. Their dinner prices are a bit expensive though. So I would only recommend this place for breakfast/lunch special.
author: Dim O.

description: Food is usually ok but if you order delivery- make sure you check your order as sometimes an item may be missing and when you call back to see if you can get a credit/refund - then they act like they can't understand what you're saying . you just throw your hands in the air and have to let it go!!
author: Eileen M.

description: We love Clay Oven! There is one in our home town in Livermore and we were so happy to see one in San Francisco. Awesome food, as always, and a great atmosphere. Will come again!
author: Brianna R.

description: Pretty good food. It was empty on a Sunday evening. I was going to give this place 3 stars but as I sit here typing up this review, there are small tiny bugs jumping onto me from the wall. Gross.
author: Shelley C.

description: This is excellent Indian food for those who appreciate authenticity of spice and flavor, and also for those looking for high-end, fresh, quality ingredients. Far from some average 'curry in a hurry' joint, India Clay Oven features fine Indian cuisine. It's a relaxed, neighborhood restaurant with an easy going atmosphere. Lamb, chicken and veggie dishes are particularly tasty.  Don't forget to sip down a Taj Mahal, mango lassi or chai tea as well.  Definitely worth checking out.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Long-time Richmond District resident, been eating at India Clay Oven for years, and more recently been getting deliveries through Eat24. This place is the real deal. While some cheapo Indian/Pakistani places try to hide the old lamb in a super spicy curry, that has not been my experience here. Everything is fresh, beautifully balanced, the spices correct, the cilantro dipping sauce (and the tamarind sauce!) are perfecto --ask for Medium or Spicy if you want a healthful high! -- and never ever forget to order onion kulcha and/or garlic naan.

My personal favorites: Tandoori Mixed Grill, Lamb Biryani, Saag Paneer, the Hyderabadi curries, the tikka masala of course, and... the pakoras! I've come to love the spinach pakoras in particular... with that killer cilantro sauce they are to die for! But they've got to be hot. If you get delivery and they're not hot, then do yourself a favor & throw them on a little cookie sheet in the toaster oven at 400 for 5 mins. Then dip them into those outrageous sauces. And order Spicy. You won't be sorry. Your body will thank you. Cheers!
author: Rebecca R.

description:
I love Indian food! There's something super comforting about a nice Indian curry with some naan. So on lazy days when I'm craving comfort food, more times than not I decide to order Indian food!

Delivery order from December 2013 thru delivery dot com:

Vegetable samosa ($4.95) - The only redeeming thing about this meal. Nicely fried. Potato and pea filling was contrasted nicely with the fried shell.

Chicken tikka masala ($12.95) - I asked for this extra spicy. And though it did have a kick, I couldn't get over the bitterness of the dish. It made it hard to eat.

Chicken vindaloo ($12.95) - Sooo bitter! So much so that I couldn't eat it! I don't know what they decided to add to the curries to made them extra spicy, but I just couldn't eat this one at all!

Garlic naan ($2.95) - Super oily and doughy. As if it wasn't cooked all the way through. Part of the goodness of naan is that I can sop up the delicious curry! Even though the curry in this case was awful, when trying to dip the oily naan, the curry just fell off. Sooo bad!

Onion kulcha ($2.95) - Same thing as the garlic naan. Super oily and doughy. 

Prawn biryani ($15.95) - Sooo mushy! Part of the reason I order rice is to mixed it with the curries I order. Since it was so mushy, the flavors just didn't blend together well.

So this was an Indian food fail! If you don't want bitter curry, oily naan and mushy rice, stay away from here!
author: Elena N.

description: Stopped by here and had a great experience! The chicken tikka masala was sooooo good. It was a creamy orange sauce with awesome flavor. We also had a good lamb dish and the nan bread was excellent. When I'm back in the sunset I will make sure I come back here for some delicious Indian food and great service!
author: Austin P.

description:
I'm a big fan of spicy food. ordered delivery form here, got the baigan bhartha and saag paneer, garlic naan and samosa, and asked for it spicy. Usually I enjoy spicy food but they made it to the point where it hurt. The food was good but it was unnecessarily spicy. If you enjoy your internal organs don't order spicy. Get medium or mild. You can thank me later. 

I still ate everything because i'm not a quitter, but it was definitely a struggle. Through the sweat and tears, in the battle of man v. spice, man won (this time). Thus I leave my word to the wise. The food was good, don't get me wrong, and the portions were a good size, but it was just CRAZY spicy. 

Also my order came to about 41 bucks which is odd for an Indian restaurant. However this is the closest Indian place to me, and after running a half marathon, I was not about to venture anywhere for food. Despite some great food in the neighborhood, the Richmond actually doesn't have much of an Indian presence, as say, the Sunset. 

 I will have to try it again and order medium (learned my lesson).
author: Thielson D.

description: Came in for a lunch buffet, and must say everything was great! The tandoori chicken was amazing! They had the normal Indian buffet items all fresh and hot coming out. Garlic Nan was delicious! Service was attentive, overall a good experience and can't go wrong here.
author: Stan C.

description: I went for the lunch buffet. Being a vegetarian, there are very limited options. Two entrees with aloo and just one with saag. The other point is that rice was not cooked properly. I could barely eat it. The rice pudding is the worst that I have had in the US. The only good part was the fresh naan. Overall, it was not a very good experience as I had expected more after reading the reviews.
author: Kamal S.

description: We shared three vegetarian dishes for dinner. All three were great along with the garlic Nan.
author: Christopher B.

description: Interesting place. The service was prompt, if a little abrupt. The food came out very quickly. My food was strange - in a fish tikka masala, I expected white fish of some kind. I was given salmon! It tasted delicious, it was just odd. My mom's biriyani was too spicy but they fixed that. The decor was pleasant except for the dead roses on every table. Might want to fix that.
author: Angela R.

description: Response from Manminder to my review: "If the curry is so easy to make, why don't you do it yourself". Good advice or maybe I will order from someone who can make it better.
author: Chethan P.

description: Worst Indian food ever in the city. The food was undercooked, peas were frozen in mattar paneer. Would not recommend it to anyone.
author: Krishna A.

description: Me and my boyfriend eat here twice a week at minimum. The service is friendly, and the food is mouth watering. I love the Coconut Curry Chicken, a perfect mix of coconut and spice. My boyfriend always orders the Chicken Tikka Masala, a blend of tomato and heaven. And when you pair it with the Garlic Nan= amazingness!!
author: Ray C.

description: Love this place! I always get the special dinner combo for two that comes with Sizzling plate combo, chicken tikka, delicious spinach dish (try it with some drizzled lemon juice) appetizers, rice and desert. That combo costs about $60 and is worth every penny
author: Lena T.

description: The food here is consistently excellent-- It's become a staple, since it seems like a 'cleaner', less oily, Indian meal.  They deliver-- and you don't need to go through a third party delivery service.  Sometimes the service can be a little challenging, but the food is always good.
author: Dee R.

description: Came to this Indian Buffet on an impromptu day off from work.  Decided to have a little adventure in the city and wanted some curry.  Location is very large and has ample seating.  We arrived right when they opened so the food was fresh and hot.  The server was also personable and greeted us pleasantly when we arrived.  Although there was not a huge selection, the offerings for the most part were all prepared well and tasted delicious.  Tandoori chicken was also juicy and tender and not dried out as it can get at some Indian buffets.  We also ordered mango lassis which were nice and tart.  The only criticism regarding the food was that they placed the fish pakora and the gulab jamun in covered containers which caused them to steam and overcook, rather than the fish remaining crispy had it not been under a lid.  The gulab jamun also was overcooked due to this.  Not a huge deal, but some things for the restaurant to note and correct.  I would however, definitely come here again if in the city.
author: Kassandra R.

description: I've been here twice and each time I'm pleasantly surprised. The food is always fresh; the atmosphere is clean and welcoming and the staff are so nice. The Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Mahkni are my favorites! The garlic naan and Chile Naan are so tasty. And you have to try the Coconut Ice cream, it's so fresh and it's homemade, so it's a perfect way to end the meal. It's my new go to Indian restaurant.
author: Allison T.

description:
In a word: Authentic. India Clay Oven seems to be an attraction for foreign tourists- I've seen tour buses stop at this Outer Richmond location and file into the restaurant. (...strange, but a testament to the taste?!)

As you enter restaurant you are welcomed by beautiful Indian decor, soothing indian music, and very attentive, friendly service. For it's namesake, the food is cooked in a clay oven. 

We ordered an indian clay oven dinner for two and were very pleased with the variety we got. It comes with Tandoori Chicken, Boti Kabab, Saag Paneer, Papadam, Rice, Nan, Raita, Kheer, Veggie Samosa & Chicken Tikka Masala. And it all was extremely flavorful and tasty. 

We left feeling cultured, our palates satisfied, and our stomachs full. I highly recommend giving this place a try for its full experience. Go hungry, order wine, and the clay over dinner for two.
author: Caroline L.

description:
Update:

The day after my original post (below), the owner of the restaurant sent me a very thoughtful and professional message. That was most appreciated. Given his prompt follow-up and attempt to make amends by offering to send me an order on the house (I declined but appreciated the thought), I am upgrading my review from three stars to four stars. 

Original post:

I have ordered delivery from here multiple times and was pleasantly surprised by the speediness of delivery (~30-40 minutes after ordering; about a ten minute drive away). However, unfortunately, the last two times have been a huge disappointment. The chicken was very, very dry both times and the last time the delivery person (in-house driver, I was told, not a third-party provided driver) didn't have any change. If a restaurant accepts cash upon delivery, then wouldn't it be a wise practice to prepare sufficient change for your delivery employees, especially if a customer specifically gives you a heads up in advance, when they order, that they will need change? Sadly, delivery also slowed down to an average of about 1-1.5 hrs the last couple times, with the food arriving cold, and, as I mentioned, the chicken dry. These most recent experiences makes all of my experiences average out to just an overall so-so now, hence the three stars.
author: I Like T.

description: Love this place. My favorite is Prawn Mushrooms! Cheese Pakora is also nice. I will come here again.
author: Yusuke T.

description:
Found a metal wire in my food. (Posted to yelp)

If the is a reflection of their kitchens cleanliness, it must be bad.
author: J C.

description:
Don't the order the Hyderabad chicken or prawns unless you like very sweet dishes. The prawns were boiled into a rubbery state,  chewy, jaw fatiguing texture. The sauce was creamy yet thin and a bit on the tepid side.

The restaurant is very attractive; beautiful linens and lovely skylight overhead, but the food leaves much to be desired.
author: Carole B.

description:
The service is impeccable. 
The food is great. Abundant and fresh. 
The decor is superb. 
Try their Chai and buffet. 
The price is decent too.
author: Juliana B.

description:
Again, I am disappointed with the quality of food.  I ordered a mild chana masala and it had no flavor!  It was as if they made the sauce and dumped chickpeas at the last minute.  Luckily for me, my roommate has a lot of Indian spices, so we re-cooked it at home and let it simmer.  It took about 15 minutes for it to be what a chana masala should be: FLAVORFUL! 

It seems that the quality of food is better when the owner is around, which is usually on the weekends.  At this point I'm probably going to make my own Indian food at home.
author: Vira P.

description:
Well, my friend works with lots of Indians in South bay and he knows what authentic Indian food should taste like since his co workers take him to many Indian restaurants there. After we ate here, he said it is no where near the indian restaurants he had been to. BUT I liked it, not a lot. 

To start, we ordered Vegetable Samosas, which is like the pot sticker for Indians , not bad not bad. Then we moved on to Nans, it is like the Indian version of Green onion pancake... but you can choose between, regular, garlic or green onion, whereas Chinese just mix them all together...then for main entrees we ordered curry chicken, curry fish and Boti Kabab (lamb leg meat), the curry tastes pretty good mixed with the Rice Pilav, which is Indian version of fried rice? Boti Kabab I have to say is the worse dish of them all. It was very dry and not salty enough, it tastes like the turkey from the movie Chritsmas vacation...

The service staff were very friendly and attentive. He recommended some dishes, tho we did not try any of them but thanks for the effort. I think we should be back...
author: William C.

description: Wonderful buffet at lunchtime with many selections.  I enjoyed their chicken masala and peas and mushroom curry the most.  I was too full to get dessert so I will need to return.  Very courteous hosts.
author: Krislyn T.

description:
Beautiful space, incredible food and service, very much enjoyed our time!

Plates are perfect for sharing family style dining.
author: Morgan F.

description:
Great loved food  love coming there 


Totally recommend  what more than habing good food
author: Rishi G.

description: Have been there twice and had an excellent meal each time.  Owner walks around checking each table to make sure they are happy and it seems everyone was so it was not just me that really liked the food.
author: Douglas G.

description: made an order 15 min before closing for dal and tikki masala. delivery came in 14 minutes and food was on point!! def reccomend
author: Benjamin G.

description:
4 stars because the chicken tikka masala (+ rice and naan) is really good and I order that on the reg and keep coming back--but I feel like a 3.5 is more appropriate because chicken korma is my favorite and it's just not the greatest here so I pass on it. The food is a little more spicy than other Indian places, so keep that in mind when selecting "spicy."  

I always do pickup because I live close and they have parking spaces reserved out front just for their restaurant! SCORE!
author: Nikki D.

description:
Started off with the vegetable samosas. The dough part was heavy and chewy and there were bits of random dough in the filling as well. The flavor of the filling was ok. Also got mango chutney on the house. It reminded me of marmalade - not something I'd spend $2 on my own. 

For entrees we had the chicken tikka masala and the saag paneer. The chicken tikka masala was packed with flavor, really good. The saag paneer, while the texture was really nice and creamy, could've used more flavor. Naan was buttery and bit flakey - fairly good but definitely better out there. 

We ended with the rice pudding. It was a nice, sweet way to end the meal.
author: Kailin L.

description:
Fantastic Service!  

We often get take-out from this neighborhood restaurant, but after a long day decided to dine in.  We arrived with family and friends (including toddlers!) and they provided AMAZING service!  Food was tasty, staff were kind, patient, attentive, fast, and helpful.  

I want to give a special review for our new favorite server, Lovedeep!  He provides excellent service and any group of diners is lucky to have him as their wait staff.  Lovedeep was so kind to the  kids and even served some special treats just for them! My little one is just crazy about him.  

Still lucky to have this as our neighborhood spot!
author: L J.

description:
I had Lamb Vindaloo, Rice, and a Mango Lasse. Very spicy vindaloo, with an odd not indian flavor. I love indian spices, but even their Basmati Rice was not traditionally cooked. I was up all night with stomach pains and the next day with cramps and such. 

Not Indian or Pakistani cooking. Their name is even a play on a well respected bay area Indian Restaurant Chain.

Service was spotty.

I suppose the silver lining is that they were empty, so their neighborhood knows they are no star quality.
author: Dean N.

description:
Ive been a loyal customer for almost 3 years..within the those years ive seen a lot of turnaround in waitstaff, and the food as lost its quality by relying heavily on lots and lots of butter. The food is way heavier than ever. After deciding to go to its buffet I was reminded of how poor the waitstaff attitude is. They walk around with their phones, their dress code is sloppy and their attitude is the worst...and that attitude is " i dont give a *uck. Its obvious they have not a concept of customer service..and im a chef of 23 years. Who wants to hear abrasive indian rap during lunch ..and loud. They seem very nervous and confused and dont understand english. Again their macho attitude is the worst. 
In regards to the food...it has lost its amazing quality Clay oven is known for. Way heavy on the butter and buttermilk...the energy of the place is heavy and dull..brought on by the waiters.

Then i found out they have a poor food rating! Im pretty angry at them...these young "dudes" attitudes have got to go. I will never go there again and i will let everyone know.

Consumer Alert: Poor Food Safety Score!

Did you know that local officials inspect food service facilities to improve food safety?

Following a recent inspection, this facility received a food safety rating that is in the bottom 5% locally, and is categorized by inspectors as "poor."

Being in the consumer protection business, we care a lot about your safety and will display this alert for six months or until we receive a significantly improved food safety rating for this business.
author: thught c.

description:
Oh man.. This place was absolutely fantastic. From walking in to walking out, this place is a must for anyone seeking great taste, the interior were lovely and the Indian music is really smoothing. 

Food was great in my opinion, it really has that authentic feel and taste to it (it is authentic) the food is cooked/baked in a clay oven. Amazing experience overall.

The only bad thing I can say about this place is the workers, they were not terrible nor rude, I just felt they didn't have any energy in them (you can really tell by the server's enthusiasm) don't get me wrong, but I feel like they can work on it or it's just a cultural thing as they were Indians.

This place also has vegetarian and vegan options on the menu which is great in my opinion, anyone is welcome here. Keep in mind that mild option has a little spiciness in it when considering hot. Also give their chai tea a try, it's creamy and has a tad bit of sweetness. 

Overall, amazing experience with my family. Don't be skeptical and take a stop by! You won't regret it. I'll be coming back next time stopping by at SF!!
author: Jason L.

description:
Underwhelming is the best I can say about this food. The presentation was the best part of the meal. The pakoras were bland and soggy, as was the papadam. The naan was also extremely bland, sort of like it had been microwaved. I had the saag paneer which even mild was overwhelmingly spicy for my palate, so much so that I couldn't taste any flavor at all. My two companions had dishes so bad that they couldn't bring themselves to eat more than a few bites. One described hers as tasting like canned tomato paste, and the other described his as bland and disappointing. I suppose this place would be fine if you've never had good Indian before, but we all ordered favorite dishes and knew what we were missing. Too bad. (The mango lassi was just fine!) 

Addendum: as we were waiting for the check I went to use the bathroom. Walked in, and walked right back out again. Toilet seat up, toilet full of urine, the whole bathroom smelled terrible, and seemed like it hasn't been cleaned in ages. Noticing that the only other customers in the restaurant were women led me to believe that it was the all-male staff that left it in such a state, confirmed when one of them came over to the table after I sat back down and offered to show me the other bathroom. Gross. And a new bar for bad in our group of friends, aka, did you think the new Mad Max was as bad as India Clay Oven? No, not that bad.
author: Erica M.

description:
I have not been here in years. I used to go when it was a small place and I think owned by another family. 

Those were the days when Indian food was hard to find, (apart from Gaylord's at Ghirardelli Square). And, most places offered a buffet to help customers get acquainted with the different types of dishes. Well, times have changed and Indian food is now in many places and the average person has become more aware and acquainted with what good Indian food is expected to be. 

For me the food was good. But I sense that for those who have really traveled and been to many Indian food places the food is okay. 

One thing I look at is price. Let's face it, Indian food is pricey. I don't mind paying a little bit more, if the food is really good. But if the food is just okay, then prices should be adjusted. I felt as if the prices could be just a bit less. Or at least offer more food on the plate. 

Now to be honest and fair, I recognize that owning a restaurant in one of the most expensive cities is not easy Overhead costs must be met. Indian Clay Oven is a fine restaurant with good food. So if you like dining out, over just eating out then India Clay Oven on Clement Street is a dining experience. Keep that in mind!

Atmosphere, ambiance and service is outstanding! Be prepared to pay, after all it is a dining experience. 

Yet for those who just want to eat some Indian food, plain and simple without a fancy price, then go to the buffet places.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
The food is just okay.

My biggest issue with India Clay Oven is their upsell of various items.  We made a typical order, and the server asked if we wanted mango chutney and the yogurt sauce.  I said yes thinking they were complimentary, nope, $4.00 tacked on the bill.  Why would you ask us if we want something that isn't complimentary?  We would have ordered it if we wanted it.

Also, when we ordered garlic nan, the server suggested we get the sampler basket.  Under his breath, I could have sworn he said it was the same price as the garlic nan.  Nope, wrong.  It was about $5.00 more.  We were just two people, we didn't need 3 large pieces of Nan for $8.00.  The server was clearly trying inflate the bill, which is successfully did.

2 entrees
2 sauces
appetizer 
basket of nan
total:
$60.00
author: Jen S.

description:
I came here for lunch on a weekday, and it wasn't very busy. But right when my friend and I stepped in, no one greeted us. We just stood there awkwardly until we decided to walk into the dining room. Then we were promptly seated at a table. However, we had just gotten our menus when we were asked what we wanted, so I feel like the servers don't pay much attention. 

I opted for the buffet, since it was only $10. There was a pretty good selection of food, and all of my picks were delicious. However, I only got one piece of naan. Also, some of the food looked like it had been sitting out for awhile.
author: Rachel H.

description: AMAZING dinner! Thank you Norman for a beautiful night, the 2nd glasses of wine and yummy ice cream on the house was delightful! We will be back asap, the food was so delish!
author: Angelica M.

description: I ordered the sweet lassi and Kashmiri lamb. Both were fantastic! Portions were just right.
author: Serena L.

description: The chicken makhni was nice and buttery. Word to the wise: 3 pieces of naan should be enough to scoop up all the curry. 4 if you're not conservative.
author: Matthew C.

description:
The food is great, staff is very friendly. 

Service is a little on the slower side and the decor is... Odd. Some aspects suggest that it should be fancy, but it's also casual. I think the windows outside, candlelight, and roses on the tables are a little intimidating, but once you get over that it's great! 

My suggestion to the owner would be to create a more inviting atmosphere because I enjoy the food and think that this restaurant deserves more customers.
author: Zelda M.

description:
Wonderful weekend buffet with fresh warm naan brought to your table when you sit down with your plate of food!  I will be returning and bringing my friends with me!
Food was fresh
Place was clean
Staff was friendly and attentive
Delicious!
author: Kristine P.

description:
Nice semi- formal indian restaurant. 
I especially like the homemade kulfi ice cream, perfect for sweet tooth !
author: Coral N.

description:
My friend and I came here for their lunch buffet and we thoroughly enjoyed the food. We were the first customers to arrive for the buffet at 11am. The restaurant was nice and really clean inside.

The chicken tikka masala was amazing! It was full of flavor. I also loved the veggie curry and the veggie pakora. The veggies weren't overcooked. The lentils dish was tasty as well. The fish pakora was alright. Their naan on the other hand, was buttery and soft. So delicious!

The service was pretty good. The waiter kept our glasses of water filled. My only gripe was that he gave us naan after we had already finished our first round at the buffet. But, besides that, you truly can't go wrong for a $10 buffet. I'd definitely come back!
author: Fallon P.

description: Took one step in the door and the server gave my friend and I the dirtiest look for no reason; I obviously left immediately because no one should be treated like that. I usually get delivery from here as well but I will no longer be supporting their business. One star!
author: Gina B.

description:
If you are looking for a full out Indian experience you gotta check this place out. From the scenario to the music to the bathroom to the waiters and the food, the culture is everywhere. It is intimidating at first but the waiters are really really nice and they always wait for you to be ready to approach you and take your order or take your plates away. 

They start you off with some flaky chip thing as an appetizer along with different kinds of dip. It was pretty good and a different taste from what I normally eat. We got fried eggplants, yogurt marinated chicken, and chicken with mushrooms. The food was all pretty decent but they don't all come with rice so make sure you are clear on what you order. The chicken was really tender and moist for the yogurt marinated chicken but the chicken with the mushroom was a bit dry. They also gave us dessert on the house, which was some sweet rice dessert. I say it was pretty ok, even better cuz it was free. The pricing is not bad neither.

Overall the experience and service and food was pretty good, definitely check this place out!
author: Benjamin W.

description: Okay I am Desi (South Asian), I am very picky when it comes to Indian/Pakistani food. The briyani was surprisingly good.
author: Sehnoosh S.

description:
We LOVE this place on weekends.  We come all the time and the wait staff know exactly what we order.  The chef is good and the serving staff are excellent.  So why the one star?  We came on a Tuesday, when the second tier staff was obviously working.  When we arrived we got seated and asked for some starters.  The samosa were cold inside.  The palak pakora was spongy and not good.  The papadum were soggy like stale potato chips.  

The Asian waiter was unfriendly and clearly not happy to see anyone.  The wine (white) was warm.  The appetizers came and they forgot the raita.  We asked again and it still didn't come.  Third time was a charm.  Then finally two came.  We only ordered one.  

The lamb chops were too salty.  The chicken came out shredded, stringy and with skin wobble on it.  It also had bones.  It's usually cubed breast meat and this time is was rubbish. I don't want joint, bone & fat.  

I would accept lousy service for amazing food, but both sucked.  I have never had such an unfriendly waiter here who just didn't care.  He knew we were regulars but didn't care at all.  So now we're no longer going to be regulars.  What a waste of time.  Complete fail.  Bad service + bad food + bad food safety rating = last time.
author: Matt B.

description: The food here was sadly pretty terrible. I absolutely love Indian food, so despite the poor reviews on Yelp, I took a risk. The garlic naan and plain naan was very dry and bland, the vegetable coconut curry had little to no flavor, and my boyfriend said his lamb curry was equally flavorless. The food also didn't sit well with either of us. Would not recommend going.
author: Karen H.

description:
This Indian restaurant is the best clean looking restaurant I have ever been to. Nice tables decorated with flower on each table, dinner napkins, and white table cloth. Looks very clean and comfortable! Another thing I love about this restaurant is their full length glass window walls! Plenty of sunlight coming thru on a nice day! Ambiance is nice, noise level acceptable. Will recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a little romantic sitting with good Indian foods. 

They serve buffet lunch (I think it is everyday cuz whenever I went there during lunch time, buffet is available) or you can order from the menu. I love their buffet, delicious foods, decent price (like $10-ish per person), also they serve freshly made naan. I think hot fresh naan are way better, so it is a plus. The value of the buffet is good considering the menu prices. 

I think their nice ambiance also comes with a higher menu prices! Their menu prices probably on average 30% more than the other Indian restaurants. I usually pay $8ish for chicken tikka masala, theirs is probably $12 for the same thing! So I think they overcharge a bit, but also can't complain too much because their restaurant also looks a little higher class than the others (like naan n curry, shalimar, pakwan, etc). 

Will recommend this restaurant for a nice ambiance, good foods, and on a sunny day.
author: Lena H.

description:
So very sad.  I had come here for the lunch buffet once before & thought it was ok, not bad, but not great.  The husband & I were in the area decided to stop by & try them for dinner.  BIG mistake.  First bad sign was the restaurant was nearly empty on a Saturday evening (peak hours), there were more staff than customers in the restaurant & the staff did not bother to hide their boredom by texting or being on their cell phones.  

Our waiter was ok he was trying to be cordial, but unfortunately was a little difficult to understand.  I don't know if it is the norm for them, but he kind of nickel & dimed us into ordering extra $2 raita & $2 mango chutney & then an extra order of rice as well as a double order of garlic naan.  I mean, it was partially our fault, but there are only so many times you can say "excuse me?", or "what was that?".  Be careful!

On to the food!

Ok so they give you a free order of papadum which (aside from the condiment sauces) was the most flavorful dish of the evening.  

Appetizer Meat Sampler:  Meat on a sizzling grill with onion & bell peppers.  Nothing exciting, but not bad.  Good with the green chutney.

Aloo Palaak (spinach & potato):  This is one of my favorite dishes & I always look forward to trying it at different Indian restaurants.  The appearance of the dish was typical.  It looks like creamed spinach with chunks of potato in it.  There was a part of it that looked like a "skin", kind of like when a dish has been sitting out too long & that top layer dries out.  I didn't really think about it until after we tried it.  You'd think that if it had been sitting it would have really concentrated the flavor, but it didn't have any flavor.  It was extremely BLAND.  It didn't taste like Indian food.  It tasted like overcooked spinach and potato, it didn't even seem salted.  We actually sent this back.  

When I sent the Aloo Palaak dish back I asked the server to have the chef try the dish because it was so bad, I had to prod the server to let me know what the chef thought.  Ultimately I'm not sure if he really tasted it or not but the server told us the chef did say it tasted plain.  

Because we sent the aloo palaak back, they were nice enough to ask if we wanted something instead of the aloo palaak.  Decided to order an Indian food that almost never fails......  Chicken Tikka Masala boy were we disappointed.

Chicken Tikka Masala:   It was kind of frightening how quickly this came out.  They must have had this ready in the back also because it was brought to our table within 1 minute of our order.   So, when I've had this in the past at different Indian restaurants, the sauce is thick & creamy and flavorful.  Unfortunately, the chicken tikka masala was extremely watery & flavorless.  The chicken was totally bland.  I had to ask for salt, this is something I've NEVER had to do at an Indian restaurant, but we didn't want to send another dish back.  We didn't finish this either.

Lamb Vindaloo:  Watery, watery, watery.  The sauce seemed under seasoned and was very thin and tasteless.  It was almost like lamb with canned tomato & a little bit of seasoning, but not enough to make it taste good.  No spice at all!   The husband was ok with it so we didn't send it back, but we didn't finish this dish. 

Garlic Naan:  Just wasn't garlicky.  There were small garlic particles on the bread, but not enough to really taste the garlic.  I could barely smell the garlic either which was weird.  Maybe they use dried garlic flakes, not fresh garlic (which is really just a sin being this close to Gilroy).  

Anyway, if you haven't gotten it yet, the food was not good.  I really tried to like the food.  They really did try to make things ok, but if they aren't making tasty food, they can't fix the problem.  They even made us an order of the Aloo Paalak to go & the server told us the chef told him it was going to be really good.  Unfortunately, on our way home both the husband & I started feeling ill & decided it wouldn't be a good idea to eat anything else from the restaurant.  

Finally, as far as cleanliness, it was ok overall.  The restaurant is beautiful.  They have fresh roses on the tables, they have beautiful murals & the outer dining room is like a sunroom.  The restroom is clean overall, but there were no paper towels.  One of the many employees that were texting or using their cell phones could have filled the paper towel dispenser.  

I wish I could give them more stars but I just cant.  I feel if they could get the kitchen in order that the restaurant could do so well, but clearly they have been failing in that area for some time (hence empty dining room).  Good Luck India Clay Oven.  You guys have so much potential!
author: Misa Y.

description: Look, this place isn't going to knock your socks off, but it does satisfy a craving and the price point it pretty great. The chicken tika is pretty flavorful, the nan is my favorite (just the plain, the garlic nan is sub-par because they sprinkle garlic powder instead of using real garlic), and the veggie korma is so creamy and good. I will say that sitting there and ordering it better than take out, which is a bummer. I will also say that the location in West Portal is 1,000 times better than this one.
author: Hannah A.

description:
I am still looking for that 4-5 star Indian restaurant.  India Clay oven is good!  But I want amazing.  Anywho here is what I ordered...

*Mattar Paneer- peas and cheese, pretty good
*Goat cheese Naan- tasty, light on the goat cheese
*Meat platter App- A nice mix of the clay oven meats, and a shit load of onions

Rice was good, spice level was good, delivery was good.  Everything was good, but the prices were for food that was better than good.  

I'd still do India Clay Oven, especially late at night after a few a few marijuana cigarettes.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Darn it India Clay Oven, I wanted to LOVE YOU. I had such huge hopes that you would serve fantastic indian food.

Sadly, this was not the case...but please don't let that deter you from trying it once.

After sushi, burgers, and sandwiches were consumed weeks before, the BF and I decided to try a little Indian. Yelp came through again and pointed us to the Geary Clement parking triangle of hell.  

This restaurant is beautiful inside. The staff is very attentive, and they have good beats playing in the background. I loved the presentation of the food and prompt service.

We ordered their famous chicken tikka masala and the Sag Paneer with naan bread.
The chicken was buttery and delicious, but I found myself adding hot sauce to add flavor.  The Sag Paneer was SAD not SAG. No flavor, bland as hell, and needing some spices.

Loved the rice, the dessert, and the various drink options. 

Hoping my dish was the exception, but we may give this place another shot.  It looked promising, and the staff truly make you feel welcome.
author: Flor D.

description:
Oh dear...this place is not good...at all.

Went here for a group dinner on a Friday night.  I can see why we were almost the only people in the restaurant.  The best part of my meal was the mango lassi.  The waiters are lovely people and I feel really bad that they have to serve such awful food.  The papadam tasted like salty communion wafers.  The samosas were heavy and tasted like dough wrapped around boiled potatoes with no peas or flavor.  We ordered 3 types of naan all of which lacked flavor and the dough did not taste fresh.  I ordered Aloo Gobi, which is supposed to be full of flavor.  This was not.  Everyone ordered other items at the table which all seemed to find a way to be equally bad for whatever reason. Even the rice was dried out and sad.  My seat faced the kitchen, which had trash all over the floor.  The main dining room floor also had a layer of grease that made it interesting when taking a trip to the bathroom.  With all of the delicious food options in the Richmond, it's totally unnecessary to ever have to go here again.
author: Karen W.

description:
I ordered take-out and regretted it. It was pricey for the worst Indian I've had in the Bay Area. The vegetable korma had pitifully little flavor. I was excited about the goat cheese naan, but unfortunately the quantity of goat cheese was so sparse that I easily forgot between bites that there was supposed to be cheese in it. And why doesn't the menu offer a simple, inexpensive side of rice? The cheapest option was a $3 plate of saffron rice. 

Honestly I felt a little robbed.
author: C. C.

description: Everything was pretty bland. We tried samosa, aloo gobi, and chicken tikka kebab. None of it had much flavor. We definitely won't come here again, there is much better Indian food to be had in SF.
author: Ran M.

description:
I've been coming here ever since I moved to the richmond. If you're the type that likes curry and rice, and thats mainly the reason you eat indian food, then you need to step foot in this place. Curry and rice is just about the most comforting duo for me. 

I always come here for the buffet because, yeah, I don't want my ratio of rice and curry to be dictated by what the chef feels like $14.95 is worth. I like drowning my rice in tikka masala or vindaloo, and eating more rice with lamb curry. Anyways, this place is pretty standard in terms of variety(in order of my opinion of what is best): chicken tikka masala, lamb curry, vegetable korma, tandoori chicken, fried carrot dessert. I've been to most indian buffets in the city, because that's what you do in your college years. And as I've grown, quality becomes a bit more standard and for sure india clay oven is the best of all the ones in the richmond + sunset.

Staff has never treated me unkind, consistent good service. Great dining room, good to take a date i suppose for dinner, (tip: don't ever take a woman to a buffet for a date, save it for the bro's), but it's risky to have indian food for a first date, unless it's Dosa or something more than $-$$. Unless she's just a tinder date, or some one to occupy your weekend.
author: Elton F.

description: The food in this place has been generally good, minus one star for the delivery service that could be a little better. This used to be my fave neighborhood spot and now I am back around. They do have vegan options which is awesome. Dine-in experience is always very good, the place is big and clean too.
author: Elisabeth C.

description: I ordered to go. The food came super fast and was very good. The chicken korma paired with the pilaf rice was perfect. I would love to go to the restaurant next time and check it out.
author: Ivania M.

description: Happy feeding my indian food craving at this place, food was gr8, little bit spicy. Ordered mushroom mattar, channa masala. Channa masala was little bit off the way. As a chef i believe channa masala comes little bit dry and chick peas should be more brown (could be done with either tea or amla). I loved parathas i ordered. Overall experience was gr8. Service was good. Price is ok but quantity as per price is less. But i will definitely recommend this restaurant for future business
author: Lakshdeep S.

description:
Wow! I have eaten here for years and the food is great. However, please let me tell you about their exceptional customer service.

My roommate and I ordered delivery from them this evening, and when we started to eat it, it was over-the-top spicy for both of us. So much so that both of us were unable to eat it our separate dishes (one vegetarian, one not). 

We called and embarrassingly explained our situation. They were VERY cordial, and long story short, they made it right before I could finish writing this review. 

Thank you ICO!
author: Garrett H.

description:
We order food here all the time, either delivery or sit in. The service is so fast and the food has great taste, quantity and quality. The staff is very friendly. 
I recommend this place to everybody.
author: S S.

description: We ordered for samosa punjabi chicken curry and saag chicken. We loved it. They need to work on their desserts. ESP the gulab jamun which was microwaved and stuck to the plate. I would recommend this place for good Indian food.
author: Kalyani R.

description: I'm quite skeptical about Indian food, but the food at this restaurant were amazing. My favorite is the Garlic Naan and the Coconut Curry. :-)
author: Joseph M.

description:
The chicken tikka masala was delicious and so was the naan.  We didn't have to wait very long for a table, and our service was great.

The set-up of this restaurant made for a more romantic/intimate dinner on our vacation than other restaurants we visited.  This would make a nice birthday dinner or date night spot.
author: Angela P.

description:
I hate to waste food, but, after tasting everything I ordered, I can't eat any more. 

It all smelled SO GOOD, but that's where the good times ended. From the appetizer, to the dessert, this was the blandest (but spicy!) Indian food. The meats were tough and sauces thrown together quickly. The naan was tough and stale AND bland. How can NAAN be BLAND? I don't know, but ask this restaurant. 

I was really looking forward to leftovers, but this is money down the drain because it's all going in the garbage. Boooooooo!!!!
author: Akasha A.

description: Didn't realize I ordered my delivery as hot, pretty inedible had to order pizza instead. Warning hot is really,really hot
author: david c.

description:
It had been a while since I had enjoyed good Indian food. I had visited India Clay Oven a couple of times about a year ago. The place hadn't really made much of an impression. I only remembered it because I liked the look of the interior. Very neat and clean. It seemed time to give it another try. The place was empty, but so was my belly. Trying to stay positive, we were glad not to have to wait for seating. 

As we prepare to order the waiter is almost sneering at us. Maybe he's having a bad night? I ask for veggie samosas, spicy lamb biryani, and spicy lamb vindaloo. We make sure to let him know we want it very spicy. His face still openly showing contempt, he says "Oh, spicy, yes. Sure.",  as he writes something down. I decide we definitely need to try a different waiter if we need anything. 

While the samosas were fine, the biryani and vindaloo were just unbelievably bland. After all the waiting, this is what we get? I would have sent it back, but all the other waiters seemed equally unhappy with a sneer here and a grimace there. What's wrong with these people? I showered this morning. I'm wearing a shirt, and my shoes. Where's the service? I didn't want any "special sauce" added along with the spices, so I just grimaced back and kept eating their sludge. No wonder this place was empty.

Given the price, the bland food, and the horrid service I would give this place zero stars if I could. I hate negative reviews. I'd like to end on an up beat. The place had one saving grace (mango lassis don't count). The nan. It is delicious. Ok, I'd give them a 1/2 star. If you just want nan and a lassi this is the place. Pissy waiters be damned.
author: Shane B.

description:
Very nice, white cloth Indian restaurant.  Prices are reasonable too.  Service just good.

Lamb tikka marsala - great sauce, favorite.  would have been great if super spicy but ordered mild for the kids.
chicken tikka kabob - good spices, a bit overdone for me but breast meat okay
punjabi chicken curry - not my favorite curry, should of stuck to coconut milk based.  spiciness seemed like it was just sambal oelek.
prawns jal frenzi -  just shrimps, not really prawns.  like 18-22 count size.  
kushmiri basmati - too wet.  stuck together like jasmine/asian rice.  i like it loose and dry.
regular naan - good to mop up the sauces.

my favorite place is kennedy's in north beach.  cheap and chicken curry is super spicy that makes my head sweaty.  i like.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Simply put: not the best, but not the worst.

The restaurant is adorable and the staff is friendly enough, but the food did not seem to match the elegance of the space.  If anything, I will be back for the ambiance.
author: Jessyca M.

description:
I ordered the chicken tikka masala for delivery and the chicken was so tough I could barely cut it with a knife - obviously 3 or 4 days old!!!!! When you are charging these prices the food should be fresh everyday!!! 
I ended up having to throw it in the trash!!!!
author: Tricia M.

description:
Have been wanting to try this place for a while, finally got around to it last Saturday. Fantastic! I had my cousin and another mutual friend of ours all of whom were very impressed. It's always think it's hit or miss with Indian buffets in my opinion, but this place is definitely a hit! Great naan and garlic naan and a great selection on the buffet. When I informed one of the cooks they were out of vegetable pakoras they brought fresh ones directly to our table! Great food, great price, and excellent service to boot. 

Every dish I tried had good spice and great flavor. This place is only a couple blocks from my house, I will definitely be a repeat customer. I would highly recommend this place to anyone in search of some quality Indian food out in the Richmond.
author: Brett L.

description: Easily the best Indian food I've had in San Francisco. Try the Chicken Makhni and their range of desserts... Yum!
author: Jackson P.

description: Great Yummy food.  bathroom is a bit sketchy but this is a great place for dinner.
author: Joan H.

description:
Not bad! 

We had vegetable pakora, prawns goa curry (prawns were a little rubbery, but I hear that's how it's made in India), basmati rice, chili naan, and an eggplant dish. 

I've had better Indian food in the city, but this wasn't bad at all and service was fairly quick (considering there was no one in the restaurant and I mean literally no customers. We were the only ones in the entire place). 

Will definitely come back sometime!
author: Alex M.

description:
I came for dinner on a Friday night and was pleasantly surprised by the ambiance; I was not expecting glass walls or crisp white table linens in an Indian restaurant, and although the room was well occupied with other dining patrons, the noise level remained relatively low.  The service was prompt, but otherwise unremarkable.  We had to specifically request the level of spiciness we wanted for our food, as we were not asked.  The main entrees all came out at the same time - too early - in fact, before I was even halfway through my vegetable samosa appetizer.   

Though the flavors of the sauces were delicious, the portions seemed small to me; I started having to dig for tikka masala sauce, even with half my rice and most of my naan remaining.  The cheese cubes in the sag paneer were too mild and therefore, tasted rather bland in the spinach sauce.  I highly recommend the tikka masala and the korma sauce (with your own preferred meats)... not just at this place, but in general.  

Lastly, there is only a single (unisex) restroom for the entire facility, meaning only one person can use the restroom at a time... seems a little risky for an Indian restaurant.
author: Carol Y.

description:
The service is probably the best part. The food is average, the curries are watered down especially on the buffet lunch menu. 
Delivery on 2 occasions has been wrong, when I called to complain they immediately corrected the order and kindly gave more dishes for free.
author: Jalpa P.

description:
I order from this place or I should say I used to order from this place. I'm not sure if they recently changed chefs or what but suddenly the food tastes different and not in a way I like. 

I used to get their Prawn Tikka Masala but the last two times I've ordered it the sauce was a totally different color and didn't taste as masala-ey (is that a word?). I thought it was maybe a fluke the first time but then the second time it had changed even more. I'm kind of disappointed. I really liked ordering from here, especially since they deliver.
author: Brittany N.

description:
We've dined in at India Clay Oven a handful of times and have been consistently delighted. The wait staff is just the right level of attentive: checking in at the right times and not hovering. They almost always bring you some sort of dessert treat on the house when you dine in. The food has always been delicious. The only downside I've personally experienced is that their floors have felt a little greasy or slippery. That's not necessarily a sign of something, however it did make me wonder about their cleaning routine.

Tonight, I logged into Yelp to order food for delivery from here and noticed a big consumer alert for a poor food safety score from the city in September. This scared me away from ordering here tonight and also made me sad. I loved this place, the staff is so nice, and the food is tasty! I then checked out their food safety score history and noticed that, until September 2015, they had a respectable score. Their score used to be comparable with other good restaurants' scores in the city. 

I hope that they're able to get their food safety score back up again soon. This was a neighborhood favorite!
author: Rae B.

description: Only got take out so can't speak for dining in, and it was fast, but it wasn't great, or hot, and I felt sick later. I won't be back. A bit over priced as well. I liked my whole in the wall place in North Beach/FiDi much better.
author: May C.

description:
It seems like I wash my clothes more than they wash their tablecloths...and they don't call me "Stinky Pete" for nothing.

Let this message encourage you to place your order to go.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Came here for the lunch buffet on Sunday. Pretty good stuff!

I thought all the serving platters/bowls were huge and really pretty. My favorite dish was this spinach dish, super tasty. Tandoori chicken was okay... and where is the gulab jamun?! Oh well, I made due with the rice pudding, which was pretty darn good :D

The ambiance here is really nice and fancy. I would def come again!
author: Jade R.

description:
