We went for the buffet on a Sunday. It's a big restaurant. Nice huge glass windows that keep you warm in the foggy Outer Richmond. 

As for the buffet.. we arrived around 1 pm and almost all the trays were empty. They never really got around to filling them up the whole time we were there. Which is really shady if it's supposed to be a buffet. Although I will have to say the items we did taste were pretty good. I liked the fish pakora best, esp when it was salmon. The lamb curry was very good. It's too bad the food was good because we wished they filled up the trays with it since you know it's a buffet! Also, the waiters were like zombies, no personality whatsoever, no smile, no emotion, blah. And their vests were soooo dirty! Very un-appetizing to see in a restaurant. The other saving grace was it was only about $10 for each. Other than that, a big miss for me.
author: Vol T.

description: If you're looking for great Indian food and a restaurant whose owner takes care of his customers, order from here. YUMMA
author: Marissa M.

description:
Lunch Buffet - Great tasting food. Lousy service.

Came on a weekday for the lunch buffet. Three servers for 3 tables. Naan is made in the kitchen and brought directly to the table. Despite having empty glasses ready for refills and an empty basket ready for naan (we are naan people not rice people), none of the servers came to our table; they continued having a conversation with each other despite one of them staring right at me as I ate. 

Bottom line - I would come back to try this place one more time as the food was enjoyable but would give it only the one chance to have better service.
author: Joshua B.

description:
After a quick Yelp search for Indian food we decided on either India Clay Oven or Star of India but found parking closer to India Clay Oven.  7pm on a Sunday evening they were pretty empty; 4 groups all together for a rather large space.  

We ordered the chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, aloo gobi, and garlic naan.  It was a very good sign that all of the dishes weren't sitting in a pool of oil.  The saag paneer was my favorite although I'm not to fond of the cheese.  (It's bf's job to pick those out.)  It was perfectly creamy without feeling heavy.  The aloo gobi, was decent but I wasn't impressed.  Maybe I just don't favor this dish and now I know.  The chicken tikka masala was at first lacking flavor but after stirring it up a bit it tasted better.  The chicken on the other hand seemed cooked ahead of time without being marinated and then mixed into the sauce after being ordered.  It's hard to f-up naan although I've had bad naan before.  It's good here.

The waitstaff was attentive and not over bearing like some Indian restaurants I've been to.  The music was a little loud but other than that, dinner was nice.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
This place is super cute! The waiters dress in vests and dress pants, there are roses and candles on the table and the overall decor is fantastic. 

Boyfriend and I decided to go here one night as it's walking distance from our place. It was surprisingly good! We got mixed vegetables and chicken tikka masala - can't go wrong with those dishes. We got two orders of regular naan, free papadum for the table and rice pudding for dessert.

The servers were kinda slow and didn't pay much attention to us. It was extremely slow for  a Saturday night. I even saw a waiter taking selfies/snapchatting in the kitchen. He's lucky I have a sense of humor.

We'll definitely be coming back.
author: Mimi V.

description: Great food and delivery service! The spicy levels are nice too. But the waiters at the restaurant is awkward unfortunatly!
author: Camilla K.

description:
I have been going to this Place for a long time and have not found better Indian food in the City or any other place in the US that I have been.  All the food has so much authentic taste and spices.  I love the Hydrabody chicken and the Spinach with paneer cheese.  The staff is very polite and friendly.

Dinner or Lunch, this place will always be what I compare other indian restaurants to.  Definitely 5 stars.
author: Will H.

description: A buddy of mine introduced me to this place on Man Night (SOA and The Walking Dead+beer).  Smaller portions but really good.  The rice as simple as it is may have actually been the best I've ever had.  The chicken tikki masala was hands down my favorite in the city.  I recommend ordering two containers, even if its just 1 person eating
author: Trevor H.

description: The food is decent, no complaints there...the service was extremely awkward, borderline rude. A $60 lunch for 2 of Indian cuisine was totally not worth the strange wait staff. I used to order here a few years back when I first moved to the neighborhood, but I stopped when it took so long to deliver. They are around the block from my home & never seem busy except for weekends. I stopped in on a whim yesterday with a friend, but I won't be back.
author: Priscilla M.

description: Great food, but not the best service. The restaurant has a beautiful interior and the windows allow for a nice breeze.
author: Angela B.

description: This place has nice ambience but the worst and tasteless indian food. I won't recommend this place to a foodie.
author: Sudarshan S.

description:
Ate yesterday (from delivery), and really really the 2 stars are for the garlic nan bread which was ok... 
Took the punjabi chicken, tasteless, and chewy, no spices... Terrible
Took also a paneer .... Not better..
If I could get a star and half that's what I would rate it.
Not to mention that my stomach was not feeling good 2 hours later
Will not order from here anymore.
author: Renaud P.

description: Been here a few times. Pretty good food, very fancy looking place, but pretty reasonably priced. I had the Chicken tikka masala, was pretty flavorful. One of the best indian places in the richmond district for sure.
author: Grant O.

description:
I've been here twice now for the lunch buffet. Let me say this, I am usually skeptical of anything buffet style, and I'm usually really skeptical for Indian fare buffets. 

This place has proved me wrong twice. Can the first time with several co-workers for a holiday lunch outing. The food shocked me, it is very fresh and very tasty. I can't comment on authenticity, but it tasted fantastic. My favorite is the saang (i think that's it) paneer (spinach paneer). I think I could eat a plate of that and be happy.  They've also got veggie and fish pakora, a veggie dish, full pieces of chicken, a chicken dish, and a few others. The buffet features the same foods, but they do them well and they are worth trying again. 

Rice pudding is probably the best I've ever had. Loved the chai too. It's not sweet, but the flavor and how it is served makes it great. Will certainly come back again!
author: Lily K.

description:
Lunch buffet was average in almost every way possible. Food looked good but was lukewarm. Veggie pakora was okay, but the fish pakora was doughy and bland. I think the foil that covers these dishes (the pakora at the buffet) in order to keep them warm messes up the texture. Most of the food was underspiced, IMHO. The dal was the only exception. Spinach paneer had almost no paneer (cheese).

I don't usually eat poultry but tried the tandoori chicken--tasty! Veggie curry was good but the vegetables were a bit overcooked, IMHO. They brought us the wrong naan (I asked for nan with chiles, but they brought a sweet nan--apparently the Kashmiri one with raisins, nuts, coconut, and cherries--it was quite good). Our water glasses were kept filled.
author: J R.

description:
Got Delivery: super fast - within 10 minutes of ordering online. (I live 1.4 mi away, though) and the packaging was very impressive. It was shrink wrapped x 10. Nothing spilled and everything was very neat and clean. (Much appreciated!)

Chicken Biryani - flavorful, just bit into a seed pod of some sort.
Bengan Bharth - eggplant dish, not too oily, good consistency.
Mango Lassi - amazingly good and I've had quite a few in my time. 

They also gave me a side of mint and tamarind chutney. The mint chutney is spicy and oh-so-good on my chicken biryani. Its so good I put the extra that I had on my omelets. 

What made this place a 4 star instead of a 3 star was the mango lassi, the mint chutney, quick delivery, and the awesome packaging.
author: Vicki T.

description:
We went here for dinner on a Sunday because our friend is craving for some yummy Indian food, it's her birthday so we wanted to grant her wish LOL We were seated right away and server was helpful with the recommendations. We got 3 dishes and they were all great! We got the chicken biryani, chicken tikka masala and one lamb dish (I forgot what it's called) but I can guarantee you they were all awesome!

The place is actually quite fancy looking, but prices are reasonable. They do deliver though, you can go to their website, order online and they will deliver! Now if I'm craving for Indian food and I'm too lazy to go out, I will definitely try that and might even update my review here including the delivery service!

Definitely going back!
author: Czarina Y.

description: We went there for Saturday brunch/lunch buffet. Good service (I was one of the first to arrive, so he made sure I had everything I needed!) Food was pretty decent, but most likely will be even more delicious if you do the regular meals instead of buffet.
author: Sheena C.

description:
The lunch buffets pretty good. Been a couple of times. I just ordered delivery, every things ok, except the "Indian style cucumber salad". It consists of what looks like one whole un-peeled cucumber, sliced, a couple pieces of lettuce and 2 lemon wedges. Missing the tomato. No dressing. No salt, pepper, oil, nuthin. Just a container with cucumbers and lettuce. 
It was only four bucks & I didn't really care. I thought it was funny more than anything and the rest of the foods kinda alright. 
My friend said I should be nice and politely tell them that it wasn't what was described in the menu & we just wanted to give them a heads up. After a confusing phone call with some dude screaming in the background, they said thank you for the compliant and that was that. I hung up the phone and took a sip of my $2 "lemonade". Crystal light. Seriously? 
I won't be ordering delivery again.
author: nic c.

description:
Love this place! Not only is the food delicious, but the staff and management are extremely friendly and kind. I messed up an online order with them where they waited outside and I never received the food, I called the next day and the manager immediately said he wanted to help and agreed to remake the order for me to pick up. When I got to the restaurant not only was I impressed with the lovely atmosphere and smells, but the bar as well. They had an all you can eat lunch buffet which I definitely will be back for. The staff and I laughed about the mistake and he even threw in a desert for me. They are awesome and the food was delicious. The vegetable samosas were a hit at my office and the curry chicken was amazing. The palak paneer was amazing and I definitely will get that again. Next time I'm in the mood for authentic Indian food I know I'll be coming here. 

-kelly
author: Kelly W.

description:
Pretty great place. 

I most often eat the lunch buffet with my kid.  It's GREAT.  Pretty cheap, nice variety.  Other reviewers said it's not authentic., seemed Americanized. Ok. Possibly true.  I eat a fair amount of Indian food, but usually Pakistani.  Im not as familiar with Indian food from other regions. What I will say is that there were no little bones  and unfamiliar meat bits in this food.  Maybe that's what they meant?

I had never been for dinner before,  but took husband a few months ago (thank you husband for agreeing to eat Indian food with me even though you eat it all the time for lunch)
We got a meal to share...some sort of special vegetarian deal for two (it's on the menu )  It was a huge amount of food, all very different flavors that went together well. I scoped out the couple's food next to us;  they had the special meaty meal for two.  It looked like an even huger amount of food.

Service was very good, we were never kept waiting, and had water refilled a zillion times without having to ask. Bill seemed very reasonable for amount and  quality of food as well as overall dining experience.  

My husband, who is the Ruler of Cheap was actually happy with the bill. We will be back next time I can talk him into Indian food.
author: El B.

description: Excellent and highly attentive service which made an impression because good service is hard to find these days. Beautiful detailed murals, tall windows and glass ceiling  1made for esthetic ambiance. Feel clean, bright and open. Food is hot, savory and delicious. Rice pudding dessert was one of the best I have tasted. Overall, one of the best restaurant experiences at an Indian restaurant.
author: Bay Area Yelper S.

description: I just finished a fabulous lamb dish and garlic naan that I picked up from here and let me tell you, I'm so excited this place is only a few blocks from my new apartment. Super good. The lamb was really tender and not stringy or too fatty, and the blended spinach that was in the dish was very flavorful and obviously fresh. YUM! Now, I can't speak for tableside service, but I ordered online and it was ready in about 15 minutes. Also the place is really very beautiful, nice ambiance. Next time I'll stay and eat there.
author: Amanda N.

description:
Overall, this was pretty good Indian Food.  But they did not hit it out  of the park.  Plus, there were some consistency issues.

1.  Easy to order on Grubhub.com.

2.  Relatively high delivery minimum ($20).  No delivery fee.

3.  Chicken Vindaloo - This was a pretty good vindaloo.  It had a nice bit of heat.  The chicken cubes were large and tender.  The potatoes were cooked relatively well.  But there were very few of them.  Flavor-wise, the sauce was good with a nice blend of spices.  However, it was thinner that I prefer for a vindaloo.  It makes it harder for it to stick to the chicken.

http://tinyurl.com/3m4x9lf

4.  Vegetable Samosa - This was a good vegetable samosa.  It had a nice crisp shell.  The stuffing was just the right consistency and very flavorful.  

5.  Onion Bhaji - This was a let down.  There are a number of interpretations of this dish.  I prefer the one that is more of a balled fritter and very crisp. Their version was more like limp and soggy onion rings.  There was a nice kick to them but they were also very salty.

6.  Garlic Naan  - The garlic did not taste particularly fresh.  It was also very dense.

7.  Rice - The rice was very well cooked.  It was very fluffy.

8.  Their prices are a little higher than some Indian restaurants but not as expensive as the most expensive Indian delivery services.

3  Sprite  $ 6.00
1  Vegetable Samosa  $ 4.50
1  Garlic Nan  $ 2.95
1  Chicken Vindaloo (w rice)  $ 14.90
1  Onion Bhaji  $ 4.95
Subtotal  $33.30
Tax  $3.16
Total  $36.46

9.  Delivery was fast.  The order was registered at 3:31 pm  The order was delivered at 4:07 pm.  Delivery time of 36 minutes.

10.  The delivery person requested that I come downstairs to get the food.  He was friendly and polite.  But I prefer delivery to my apartment door.  

11.  Overall, the food was good.  I will order from them again.  With just a couple of improvements, they would have pulled out four stars.
author: Mark D.

description: Well then! Quite possibly some of the spiciest food I have ever consumed. It's spicy or normal here no in between. Rate this place at a 10 on the spice rack, just tell them you want it spicy. I laugh at ghost pepper buffalo wings, I feel like the chefs must be laughing when they add the extra spicy! White table cloths+paper. Friendly staff, roses on the table, candles. Highly recommend as far as North Indian food goes. Winning.
author: Nathan B.

description: Excellent Malai Kofta. Don't order anything as MILD flavored. They just add water to the spicy version, serve it and expect us to believe it, and it tastes bad.
author: Chandramouli S.

description: Overall Indian clay oven is a good spot. It's more pricey then lots of Indian places by a small bit. Don't really think it's that much better in terms of taste, but what do I know?
author: Nathan A.

description:
We were impressed by the food and the attentive service. We had their Saturday lunch buffet, and it was a great value. Fresh naan kept rolling out of the kitchen for our table. Their garlic and cherry naan are delicious.  The curries were flavorful. My personal favorite was the Saag Paneer.

I will definitely be back.
author: Ruby L.

description:
Terribly OVERPRICED! Even for LUNCH! 
$20.45 for Korma, rice, and naan: this was an order for PICKUP. 
The lunch buffet is $9.99.  Why do they screw their take out customers?  If there's a lunch buffet for $9.99 I would recommend they make their lunch menu comparable for their take out customers.  I've also seen buffets that charge the buffet price and allow a take-out customer to fill a to-go box.  The food tastes authentic - I enjoyed it... once I was able to track down a spoon and fork at my office with which to eat it.  Take-out orders should automatically be furnished with the appropriate utensils, napkins, and condiments.
author: CHAD C.

description:
Another lazy day or ordering in.  

We ordered bengan bhartha, sag paneer and bhindi bhaji masala, with one plain naan and one mushroom cheese chili naan.  I don't usually get anything but a plain naan, but we thought we'd try this since it sounded so good.

The food arrived within 30 minutes.  Yes!!!  OMG, the portions were so humongous we figured we could eat it for days.  The bhindi bhaji was extremely delicious I think I could have eaten the whole thing.  But, I had to eat the others so went onto the began bhartha and was not disappointed at all.  The sag paneer was just as good as everything else. The most surprising was the mushroom cheese chili naan.  Not expecting to enjoy it, I was totally surprised at how good it was.

I will be ordering again or visiting the restaurant down the street soon.
author: Janette F.

description:
Mind you, this is a late review. My expectations were pretty low when I first visited India Clay Oven. They certainly proved me wrong! They have a great lunch buffet and I've ended up returning to this place on numerous occasions. 

Downside: Try your best to find free parking in the neighborhood or wait for someone to leave so you can pay for parking. Beware of the parking nazis!
author: Jasleen K.

description:
[M]ona: 4 Stars
[W]ayne: 4 Stars, 3.5 considering someone stole my umbrella.
Average: 3.75 - 4 Stars

+ Good Service 
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Not Pricey
+ Nice Ambiance

- Our umbrella was stolen
- Slow Service
 
[W] Today we wanted to use something from Mona's Entertainment book because she ALWAYS want to try something new. (I don't know if I can keep up with all these unwritten Yelps! haha). We had some coupon for a buy one get one free type of deal for a $13 value. We ended up just eating their lunch buffet which was quite good and inexpensive. We paid $9.95 per person for lunch so that wasn't too bad considering you can stuff yourself silly. I know in one of my reviews that I said Naan-N-Curry is the bomb-diggity but India Clay Oven is a great alternative minus the parking. 
 
So again, $20 at Naan-N-Curry for 1 plate of Chicken Tikka Masala, 1 Naan, and 2 orders of rice versus $20 for uhm.....EVERYTHING haha. But yea, if you have an appetite for some Indian food this is the place to be. You can check out the pictures to see all the food. I'm not going to go through all of it because they were equally delicious. The only difference is that they cook their rice with peas I believe. So it's like a mix of Chinese fried rice but Indian style haha. 

I think the dish that I enjoyed the most was the curry chicken, their fried fish (I believe it was salmon), and their mixed veggies. Normally the Chicken Tikka Masala at most places are dry but here at India Clay Oven, I think they BBQ the chicken then dump it in the curry. It was so moist and tender mMmMm Yummy.
 
The layout of the restaurant is pretty nice as well. It's like glass over half of the ceiling so there's a lot of natural sunlight coming in. The only weird part is that the food is in the hallway from where you came in. So you kind of half to walk by the kitchen and the check-in booth to get to the food. I can't really explain but you can always go and see for yourself. A buffet is going to be a buffet so I don't think there's any 5 star buffets in my opinion other than Las Vegas maybe? You can't say no to crab and steaks! Haha. But then again this is an Indian buffet and not Vegas. I don't think they can afford to give unlimited steak or I'd be there with my Tupperware haha (shh i didn't say that.......back to ghetto Chinese roots haha jk)  

[M] The service here is quite efficient. Everyone greets you with a smile. However, service was kind of slow. Wayne and I almost finished a game of chess on my phone before the waiter finally returned our card back. 

Overall, we had an enjoyable time dining at Clay Oven. We will be back to use the coupon again.
author: Mona C.

description: Delicious, full of flavor! Friendly! Affordable! Loved the lamb curry. Everyone was happy with their meal.
author: Patricia C.

description: I accidentally posted a review to the wrong place.I've never been here and yelp won't let me delete my review. :(
author: Adrian O.

description: I take lunch here about once a  month with coworkers. The lunch buffet is uniformly tasty, but the selection never seems to change ... I'm not left wanting for something to eat and, of course, the lunch buffet is "all you can eat."
author: Henry M.

description: I live in the Richmond not far from Clay Oven so I go there frequently and have ordered out also.  The noon buffet is about as good as it gets.  A must for everybody.  I love their curries as each has a different taste.  The nan is very good and they have half a dozen other breads to choose from.  The spice level is moderate but they will spice it up for you if you ask.  The ambiance is very nice for the Richmond.  Marble floors, white linen table cloths with a fresh rose on every table and large wine glasses for the water.  The waiters have always been attentive and friendly.  After a buffet lunch you will not need dinner.  The only reason I don't give them 5 stars is because they are not " Down Town " and no strolling violins  HA HA.  Go  and enjoy.
author: Bill P.

description: Awesome indian buffet. Really good desserts but all the entrees and appetizer dishes were delicious. Only problem was the 2 dollars for tea. I'm really surprised that it's not complimentary like other places. Maybe it's just me. Really good place  for just buffet though (only 9.99 per person).
author: Ruobin W.

description:
I've only had the lunch buffet here. Don't know why. I think they always have the buffet during weekend afternoons and thats usually when I would venture out to the Richmond district. Who knows. 

Buffets. As much as I love to eat, my stomach just can't handle all that food. (Hey, I'm Asian. Gotta get my money's worth) That's why I usually avoid buffets. Otherwise someone would have to carry me out on a stretcher...or forklift...

Anyways, back to India Clay Oven. In short, this place is a perfect quickfix for my tandori and curry cravings without hurting my wallet ($8/person) and hence, my stomach is safe.

The food does get a little boring. The selection's not big and they never change the menu. So I only go there when I'm intensely craving for the food and I feel like pigging out.

3 stars for the food.
1 star for the beautiful decor & tall windows (not like the usual janky Indian/Pakistani places...sorry n&c)
author: Marti L.

description: I have been a customer of India Clay Oven for over 10 years.  And I typically don't take the time or have the time to do a review.  But my last 3 experiences have been so awful, that I feel obligated to let others know about it.  I have ordered delivery these last 3 times.  And 1 of the 3 was ridiculously late.  But that's not the main reason for complaining.  Over the years, they have steadily raised their prices (50+%) and given smaller portions.  I was tolerant of that, if the quality stayed at least the same.  But now the food is pretty inedible (burnt lamb and chicken meals) and now WAY overpriced for the quality and portions.  On my last order, I actually threw 3/4 of the food away.  I was so angry that I had to pace in my kitchen to calm down!  Anyway, it's a shame,.  I really liked this place and will never eat there again.
author: Steven V.

description:
I always love the food here, and the seating and decor is fairly nice. There usually isn't a wait to get in, and the service is very accommodating. I've been here many times, and I've never been disappointed by my experiences. 

I usually order the chicken tikka masala, the garlic naan, the chicken tikka kabob, the bengan bhartha, and the lamb biryani. The lamb biryani is my favorite! Also, order the raita and the mango chutney for the naan and complimentary papadums! The chicken tikka masala isn't the best I have ever had, but I always have to order it an any Indian restaurant. The bengan bhartha is very good though, and the chicken tikka kabob is as good as any other restaurant--nothing special. 

If you're in the area, hit this place up!
author: Chloe T.

description:
I ordered a lunch for two from here that included a nan combo for two, veggie appetizer combo for two and a veggie curry. Why 3 stars? Allow me to show you the numbers:

Staples used to pack the whole order: 6 (I'm always afraid of having to take these off carefully and place them in the trash can before I eat so I don't accidentally ingest them. Aren't there other ways of packing food rather than stapling the heck of out it??)

Number of samosas in a TWO person appetizer combo: 1. Are we supposed to split it? I guess, pyaar badhtha hai but really??

Number of containers of chutney for the appetizer combo: 1 (a dinky one at that... I ate like one pakora and it was all gone. The best part about ordering food is then reminiscing about the food later. Subsequent meals should have a tiny magical ingredient left over from the meal you ordered... Like freaking chutney! At the very least, please provide sufficient sides to tide over while two people awkwardly eat the solitary samosa that is part of the combo meant for TWO people.)

Number of napkins: 0 (I'm eating Indian food. It's eaten with your hands. Please include napkins, even though I appreciate that you're environmentally conscientious. I promise I will recycle or compost as appropriate). 

The food was average, but good for the price. Delivery was quick and friendly. If they pick up the slack on these careless mistakes, I'd order from here again.
author: Meg P.

description:
Holy Macaroni! The food here is amazing! It tastes best on a sunday afternoon when I am so very hungry you know?? So I highly recommend their lunch buffet, especially on Sunday even though I know its probably not any different from Monday-Saturday. 

Highlights:
Food: everything is tasty, I wont insult culture and try to spell out all the dishes, but I recommend all and everything. The tikka masala is delicious, and the rice pudding is out of this universe yo!
Drinks: mango lassi, instant classic a bit pricy. The chai tea, a wonderful addition to your lunch buffet! if your with your partner, one is enough to satisfy the both of you! it is rich and creamy.

Forewarning: Do not force yourself to finish the plate. One plate will be enough to last you the day. You will notice this feeling of saturation right as you stand up to get seconds, therefore seconds usually turn into dessert. Which I say load up on big boy. 

Negative:
It is kinda really hot in there, wear your cute summer gear, leave the sunblock at home ;) 

Otherwise, friendly service. Ask for the naan, otherwise it is slow to be brought out. 

"Its just surr guurd" I said.
author: Michelle X.

description:
The first thing you notice about India Clay Oven is the amazing dinning room.  The restaurant sits in a gorgeous building with tall front windows, high ceilings, and elegant decor.  

The service was very prompt.  We ordered the shared dinner for two.  This option comes in vegetarian or carnivorous.  It was amazing!  It offered a great sampling of 2 appetizers, 3 main courses (which was the top 3 people usually pick anyways), and also dessert.  I didn't mention the sides, but the meal came with rice/naan carbs.  

I thought the price was great.  We received high quality food and also large portions for a variety of dishes.
author: Kristina B.

description:
I've eaten here quite a few times in the past, had never had a strong opinion of the place, but it had been a while, so I decided to refresh my memory of India Clay Oven before writing a review.  I try to be fair, and the place could have changed over the years.  Unfortunately, it was worse than I had recalled.

Stopped in on a Friday night with some friends.  Firstly, on a weeknight night at prime time, the restaurant was completely empty.  That's not a good sign, is it?  Service was very quick and attentive, but again... it was empty.  Our waiter was just standing around looking at us.

We ordered quite an assortment of food to share - seekh kabob, tandoori chicken, vegetarian biryani, saag paneer, paneer makhini, assortment of sides (naan, rice, chapati, raita), beverages.  Over $100 for 4 people.

I am a huge fan of Indian food... it's one of my favorite cuisines, and I feel like I will tolerate a very wide range of quality just because I love the stuff so much.  It's hard to go completely wrong.   Yet this was just that - completely wrong.  Everything we were served was incredibly bland.  Despite our requests to have dishes made "very" spicy, there was no discernible heat to any of the dishes.  The seasoning tasted salty/black peppery more than anything else.  The paneer in the makhini and saag paneer tasted a little odd, and the lamb had a distinct "off" taste - we couldn't even finish it.  Rice and breads were very dry.  There was literally nothing in our meal that would warrant 2 stars, nothing to make me want to try this restaurant again.

I left feeling pretty frustrated at just how bad the food could be at a restaurant with 3.5 stars - I wasn't expecting the meal of my life, just you know... something that wasn't disgusting.  The price tag was also outrageous given the quality of the food. 

Quest for good Indian food in the Richmond continues... :(
author: Heidi M.

description: Good food, mediocre service (I know our industry sucks, but your welcoming committee is one step short of Dic's Last Resort), good ambiance, nice variation from our neighborhoods prolific East Asian fare.
author: JD D.

description:
This is the best Indian food I've found in California so far. I've been here multiple times and have been very pleased with the food, service, ambiance, etc every time.
The rice alone makes this place good!
I've never found a restaurant that makes a better aloo gobi than mine, until I had it here. At first taste, I was trying to figure out how they made it soooo goood.
I gladly incorporate this restaurant into my visits from the Sacramento area.
author: CrapulentMoose ..

description: This is a great buffet in the weekends. Extremely affordable, great ambiance and very tasty food. Today we told the waiter that the chicken boti is cold on the buffet and immediately he prepared an a la carte order and didn't charge us for it. Everything is tasty, quick and cheap. And interesting enough the ambiance is very nice with table clothes and flowers. Tika masala is delicious, dal is very tasty. I didn't try anything I didn't like. And the waiters are really trying hard to please you. If you're in a hurry, you can get in and out in 20 minutes and have a great food still.
author: bora o.

description:
Very decent place and good food. This restaurant really doesn't deserve the 1-2 stars that some customers are giving. We just had a very enjoyable family dinner here. The ambiance and decor are very nice. Food is pretty good, portions are on the small side but reasonable for one person. You can easily share several dishes for the table. We had chicken tika massala and chicken makni which were quite tasty. The table next to ours looked like they were having chicken tandoori which looked yummy as well. Waiter was ok, dishes were served promptly and he checked on us.
Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant for a laid back, family dinner. We will be back!!
author: Laurene S.

description:
The food is always rich and flavorful.

Favorite Dishes: Paneer Makhani; Vegetable Korma; Garlic Naan

Delivery is really fast and a great alternative for late night ordering.

Cons:  The price range is a little high. The waiters don't come by often and are usually out of view, so getting their attention takes time.
author: Anna H.

description: Really fresh and quality ingredients. I know I shouldn't compare to Naan n Curry, but so much better! We go the chicken tikka masala - big chunks of chicken breasts; the okra dish - nice, non-mushy okra with lots of onions; the vegetable dish with the cream sauce and almonds - really nice. Each dish had its own sauce profile. Added onion kulcha, chapati and rice on side. Kulcha and rice were great, chapati ok. We ordered online for pickup, but the interior looks nice so would eat in next time. FYI, hot is actually very hot. I would choose medium spicy next time.
author: Susan H.

description: Pretty solid Indian fare for reasonable prices.  The food was fresh and fast, the dining room clean. The staff were not overly friendly but polite and just the right amount of attentive. We went on Valentine's Day, sort of last minute, but they fit us right in.  There were no specials offered, but there were red roses on the tables, not sure if that's standard. The restroom was not terribly clean but we came right in the middle of the day, maybe they didn't have a chance to clean it? My husband had the Korma, medium spiced and it was lovely. I had the Kashmir Chicken, also medium, which was all right but not very spicy.  We both had naan bread and rice.  There was not really enough rice but they were nice about bringing us some more when we asked.  My husband had a mango lassi that was great and I had a glass of white wine that was OK.  Neither of us liked the papadams as they were greasy and a bit strongly flavored (anise?). Overall, we were happy with our meal and would go back again, but I'm sure it's not the best Indian restaurant in the city.
author: Maryann K.

description: Really like the nans here. Always very fresh and nicely done. The staff are also extremely helpful, polite and friendly. Overall a good experience from time to time
author: Nitish S.

description: Terrible food and service! We ordered a mild entree and it was made extra spicy. When asked to change it they just added water to the dish! Plus the aloo parantha had almost no aloo in it. The wait staff didn't seem concerned by our feedback of the food.
author: Surbhi J.

description: Outstanding service and food!  The servers even mentioned a car was being towed and asked the customers if it was there car!  Amazing. Will definitely return!!
author: Asa C.

description: I'm an experienced Indian connoisseur and India Clay Oven on Clement St. is my favorite. The environment is perfect for a quiet evening with delicious curries. The seafood, chicken and vegetable dishes are everything you want in indian food - nothing too oily or heavy, and has plenty of flavor. The dishes have plenty of variety. My new favorite is their chicken mulligatawny soup! The end of the meal always comes with a rice pudding on the house - wait for that phrase to be quoted. If not ask for it because they don't mind serving it for free. The manager, Norman, is a kind gent. My lady and I loved one of their bowls so much he generously gave us one to take home. India Clay Oven all the way!
author: Chris F.

description:
Pros:
- Gorgeous setting and kind staff
- Ordered take-out that was made fast
- They were generous with the paneer and portions...my order served as 2 meals.
- Naan was good.

Cons:
- My paneer makhani was SO watery and diluted...I'm used to a thick sauce...this was orange water. The flavors were diluted as well, making it unappetizing.
- Pretty pricey...$12.50 for paneer makhani, $2 for plain naan, $2.95 for basmati rice.
author: C W.

description: This review is for their lunch buffet. The interior is very classy. Tandoori chicken was moist and flavorful. Everything else was just mediocre and didn't have much taste. The pakoras were cold and the naan was disappointing. We probably will not be back especially given their low health inspection rating.
author: C L.

description: A big no no if u r ordering online. I took two hours. Food was good thats y i gave 2 stars
author: Tulc K.

description:
Its hard to predict what will make a difference between 4 and 5 stars - in the case of ICO on Clement st., it was the complimentary Chai at the end of the meal. I'm not  a fan of milk in my tea, i think it ruins a product that should stand on its own.  ICO - has convinced me otherwise, and they did it gratis! Im sold. When Renee, said "I could go for some Indian food" and pointed to ICO as we were passing by i vaguely recalled going there years ago, and somehow being upset about something. But with properly attentive staff, clean and well designed interior, and super delicious food (Hyderabadi Vegies, and Vegie Korma that Renee had), my expectations kept being exceeded. Thanks ICO, will return.

ps you know those times you go home and you quickly go over the food options and settle on reheating some left overs - then when you get to the said leftovers you just give it a try to see how it is cold? Well with ICO leftovers there was no reheating just scarfing down.
author: Oleg H.

description:
The place is good, the food is good, but over the past two years they have been on a steady slid towards smaller portion sizes and higher prices at the same time.  To that I say BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!  

They had my attention with the good Indian delivery, but they they started switching out the regular togo boxes that they would use to a new plastic cup that is usually half filled itself as well giving you about half the portion size that you would have gotten 3 years ago.  

AND
 
At the same time, alllll of their prices have gone from a reasonable 6-9 a dish to 11-15 dollars a dish!  

WTF?!!  uh..  am I a tard or is this place trying to bend me over!? 

haha...  the food is good, is it $15 for a cup n a half of prawn tikki masala...  umm no...
author: Anthony Z.

description: Place is fantastic.  Wife had the buffet and I ordered off the menu.   Both of us left full and very pleased.  Exceptional service on a Sunday afternoon.   Will be back.  Thank you to the management and staff---job well done.
author: Johnny C.

description:
My hubby and I decided we should try something knew on this particular Saturday and had read on yelp that they had a very good buffet.

The place looks really nice inside with beautiful murals painted on the walls depicting what looked to me like biblical right out of a story. I may just be the beauty of the land itself. 

The service was friendly and prompt. They have many food options that are kept in these deep clay oven pots rather than as in most buffets you see things under heat lamps that seem stale.

I have to mention that recently I did do a check their inspection score from  http://sf.everyblock.com where it tells you what a business scored on it's health inspection. Theirs was still a good rating but still had some violations that may be a concern to some that may pose a small risk of food born illness. I won't elaborate here but you're more than welcome to read further yourself on the site provided. Hopefully they are working on fixing this. 

 I would just make sure to check the site every once in a while to get updates before dining at any restaurant. I did notice thought, that not too many yelpers include this type of information or take it into consideration while writing a review of a restaurant. I just hope this will encourage more people to not over look this important detail, as you wouldn't want to end up feeling sick the next day.

Aside from this, the food was really great and full of flavor. Nothing tasted stale and was often replenished. And for around $10 bucks for all you can eat, beats out all the buffet chains and sizzlers who don't offer much quality for the price. Oh and try their Mango Lassie. It's like a fermented kefir type drink with mango flavor. Sort of like an Indian version of a smoothie. It was very good.

I will probably go again, but am hoping they will take care of those pending violations soon. That's why I had to mark it down a star.
author: Petra S.

description: Tried all their lamb dishes. Meat were tender but sometime you can get a chewy bit. Sauce was creamy and delicious. Price is affordable.
author: Robert S.

description: My parents use to love this place and were very excited to go back for the first time in a while. We ordered the shrimp tandoori, the chicken tiki masala, and a lamb dish. The shrimp was the most disappointing dish we received it was a pile of sizzling onions and green peepers with a touch of 5 shrimp for a shocking 17 dollars. We were very disappointed and will not be coming back any time soon
author: Yoshio B.

description:
Lunch buffet review.  I'm a little surprised at the 4 and 5 star ratings this place is getting, but they mainly seem to be for NON buffet food.  

Most of the meats are overcooked, especially the chicken legs and lamb.  The naan is brought fresh to your table, and while it's good, it's nothing to rave about.  From the lineup, I'd probably say the fried fish was the best.  I guess if I come back, I'd order from the menu.  In the end, it's unfair to expect a lot from a $10 buffet.  I wouldn't recommend the lunch buffet to those who like more traditional quality food?  It's good, but just doesn't seem to have much of flavor profile and comes across a bit "Americanized".  Their lunch buffet items could definitely use more love (herbs and spices)!

The good thing about this place is that there's plenty of space and large rear section for more private seating.  Beware that portions of the hardwood floor in the back area is really bumpy and somewhat dangerous if you aren't watching where you're going.  I think there was probably a water leak at some point and now the hardwood has expanded and buckled up into tripping hazards.
author: Christopher L.

description: Delicious and non-greasy Indian. The palak dal was amazing. Too bad they charge so much or I would be eating there all the time
author: Chris D.

description: Bargain bharta was really nice. Overall the taste was very nice. Service was nice. The rice kheer in the end was awesome.
author: Hardy K.

description: We've tried other Indian restaurants in San Francisco, but keep coming back here.  High quality meat in the dishes.  Favorites are the Chicken Tikka Masala and Vegi Khorma.  Interestingly, the take out portions seem to be a bit larger than those at the restaurant.  Our kids love this place too.  Just order it with mild spice for them.
author: Dave W.

description: I've been to this place many times and even tried their take-out.  This place is large and I've never had to wait in line.  The restaurant can accommodate large parties.  I always liked this place for its cleanliness, decor and staff.  Oh yea the food also yummy and cheap.  Beware, Indian food is spicey, especially the soups.  You'll need a ice cold Lassi to keep it in balance.  My favorites order is Chicken Masala, Korma, Kashmir Naan, dahl, and a Sweet or Mango Lassi.
author: S F.

description:
First of all, I feel sorry for  people ...who previously voted this place with five stars. This place actually has never ever even once served  food which deserve to be awarded 5 stars. 
These are the Indian restaurants which has made the Indian food look SO BAD, I MEAN REALLY BAD AND DISRESPECTABLE.PLACES LIKE CLAY OVEN, NAAN & CURRY, STAR INDIA ON GEARY STREET ETC. THESE GUYS ARE COMPLETE INSULT TO INDIA S GREAT FOOD AND CHEFS . 

Ordered for bunch of food and not one thing  tasted like food. Was so hungry and ate some of it.
SHAME ON YOU GUYS  TO PRODUCE SO SO SO TERRIBLE FOOD AND CALLING IT INDIAN FOOD.  Call it clay oven food not Indian please. I don't see a Zero star option  on yelp. TERRIBLE   INDIAN FOOD. I have given them 5 chances not one was any good.
author: Sri G.

description:
FYI this review is for their delivery only. 
Our office just ordered food from India Oven and while most of it was standard I was really let down by the Mushroom Masala. I was expecting basically Chicken Tikka Masala but with mushrooms....be forewarned....it is nothing like CTM. Its just mushrooms and a lot of onions in a really really oily bland sauce. I ended up stealing CTM sauce from a coworker just to give it some flavor. I now know I was incorrect in assuming the dish would have the same kind of sauce (masala just means mixture) but the dish still tasted really bad and I wouldn't want anyone to make the same incorrect assumption that I did. The rice was ok...kind of dry. Basically the price doesn't match the food. Theres a plethora of better Indian food in town for less so I don't think Id choose to order from here again.

I would've given this place 3 stars because the food wasn't grossly horrible (well the Mushroom Masala was, but the other dishes I tried seemed ok), but I knocked them down 1 star because when they brought us the food there were NO utensils and nothing was labeled. Trying to decipher the different dishes by smell and appearance was no easy task!

UPDATE- apparently the restaurant is saying that the missing utensils was the fault of the delivery service we ordered through. That doesn't really change my rating because the food was delivered late and my Mushroom Masala was pretty inedible and upset my stomach. So there you have it. I don't generally give bad reviews based on one dish and I'm sure they do some things well, but I certainly wont be eating here again.
author: Seana L.

description:
Alright, I like value. 
Value is another term for cheap.

Well... not so fast.

Take Clay Oven, at a modest few bills, patrons get a steal for an all you can eat lunch buffet along with a fine dining room.

this is value.  In this review, I have included a few notes on Indian cooking, which I find hard to replicate at home.

(note: before my review of Indian food, a moment of silence and prayers go out to the people killed in the terrorist attack in India. Seriously , very sad)

A mélange of aromas from various spices permeates through entire space at Clay Oven.  The sixty five seat neighborhood restaurant provides patrons with a tasting menu with their all you can eat lunch buffet (8.95).  Tables dressed in white linen and glass cups set the tone for a charming meal. The high ceiling and wide street side window creates a cozy dining area.  Noticeably, the wait staff is very attentive, constantly refilling beverages and collecting plates.  Once seated, a basket filled with blistered crispy naan starts the meal.  As the name suggests, the menu revolves around char-roasted meat and rich curries.  

Starting my spice excursion, I start with a generous mound of rice pilaf.  Sweetened with sweat green peas, the fluffy basmati rice is flavored with saffron.   Known as one of the most expensive spices, saffron comes from dried stigma of a flower -often used in both coloring and flavoring in Southwest cooking.  With a thick consistency and vibrant green color, the saag paneer which is mild in spice goes very well with the naan.  Eaten both in India and Pakistan, the curry is based on spinach and mustard leaves.  Fried into meteorite -like shapes, the vegetable pakora lacked crispiness and flavor. 

Similar to the Japanese tempura, the vegetable is battered and fried.  Resembling fish 'n chips, the meat from the fish pakora was flaky.  The sweet chutney adds sweet flavor to the otherwise bland fried creations.  

The tandoori chicken steals the show.  Known as a semi-fried chicken delicacy that originated in the Punjab region, the meat is marinated in yogurt and seasoned with tandoori masala.  While the tandoori masala varies from region to region, the base spice mix includes garlic, ginger, cumin, and cayenne pepper.  Cooked at high temperatures in the clay oven called tandoor, the chicken tastes smoky while the spice adds a sweet aromatic flavor.   

The curries are exceptional and pair well with the rice.  The chicken curry is a rich intense curry.  Boneless chicken bathes in a red sauce piping with oil and flavored with paprika and chilies.  Tender lamb pieces make up the lamb curry.  For dessert, the kheer (rice pudding) helps cool off the spice while the gulab jumun (brown cottage fried ball) soaks in flavored syrup is offered. 
Indian cuisine is often associated with a sophisticated blend of spices.  

India's religious belief and culture plays a very influential role in their culinary arts.  For instance, many worshippers of Hindu and Buddhism are vegetarians.  Clay Oven serves North Indian cuisine and it is differentiate by a high consumption of dishes with dairy products such as milk and yogurt.  Other common ingredients include nuts, saffron, and chilies.     

Many Indian dishes are cooked in ghee, also known as clarified butter.  A spoonful of ghee adds a rich consistency along with a nutty taste.  While cooking Indian food, a well known technique is baghaar with infuses flavor by dropping spices into hot oil.  Cinnamon, mustard seeds, red chilies, and bay leaves are popular ingredients used in this cooking technique.  

Many recipes also require spices to be grinded.  A great example is to taste the difference between ground pepper that has been sitting around compared to the fresh nutty smell of freshly ground pepper.  Instead of adding cream to create a thick sauce, Indian food use yogurt that adds a creamy texture and a dash of tartness.
author: Rayfil W.

description:
At around $11 for a lunch buffet on the weekend, India Clay Oven does not offer enough meat variety.  The two chicken and one lamb options were decently flavored, but the rest of the vegetable options left much to be desired in terms of taste.  We were forced to unavailingly ask the servers for more naan, and they did not fulfill our requests quickly until we were almost done.  

I will look elsewhere to satisfy Indian food cravings.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Ok, so I must admit, I LOVE Indian food.

This place is a bit more expensive than most Indian places in the city, but the food is delicious, portions are super generous and the service is amazing. They are so super friendly, you just can't help but smile the entire time. 

I live right up the street from this place, so it's definitely my go-to Indian place. I come here so often that they recognize me. (They even know that I like extra peas in my rice). 

The restaurant itself is nice too, lots of windows, so a great spot to people-watch (who doesn't love people-watching?).
author: Helen D.

description:
When I lived in the Outer Richmond (up until a few months ago), I used to come here all the time, and now that I live in Rockridge, I really miss this place.

For the bargain price of $9.95, they have the best Indian lunch buffet I've experienced, and I've tried many. The service has always been wonderful, water glasses are frequently refilled, and they bring fresh, delicious naan to your table. Their pakoras, channa masala, saag paneer, chicken makhani (similar to tikka masala, but better in my opinion), and kheer are all excellent. I've also been here once for dinner, and while it's quite a bit more spendy in the evening, the food was superb.

With the white tablecloths, the beautiful serving dishes, and smartly uniformed waitstaff, it feels pretty classy too. Definitely a date-worthy establishment.
author: Jamie T.

description:
Worst sevice ever!!!! Never again! Visiting from out of town and not even a greeting. The host asked us "What do you want?" when taking the order. Not once did they ask if everything was ok, if we needed anything else. Not even water was filled. Once we received our food, no one came back to help us. We asked for the check, and the waiter started cleaning up and making loud noises while we were still enjoying our tea at the table. Not worth the time. Even the table next to us, were upset!! The food it not traditional, watered down, and nothing like the pics online. Oh! and you would think a nice place like that would update thier dishes!!!! White plates and mugs with gray.silver scratches all over! Looks super old and dingy!!!

I love how all the recent reviews are 1 star!!!! No food quality here!
author: arti n.

description:
The WORST AND HORRIBLE COCONUT CURRY I've ever had in my entire life on this earth,the chef is so damn lazy beyond belief to blend the coconut flake into smooth form,just tossed it on the sauce.just like eating coconut flake curry instead of coconut curry.DISGUSTING!!!

The Punjabi curry sauce tastes nothing more like chana marsala.CHEATING!!!
author: Ryu K.

description: For my husband and me this is  the best  Indian food of all the C O . Good buffet and good dinners  to celebrate different occasions . Bravo!!!!'
author: Sara T.

description: Great samosas! This place made me love Indian food! I've been to other Indian restaurants and this place still is the top for me!!! It so clean and the food is so fresh! Agh I love this place!!
author: Prima D.

description: Excellent flavorfull indian food, their spicy dishes sure have a nice kick that i enjoy, excellent service, clean dining environment , what else could i ask for? , they have lunch buffet from 11-2pm i believe, which is great if ur on a budget or if u just have an indian food craving, i highly recommend this place
author: John G.

description:
We eat frequently at Indian buffets and have never had quite as strange an experience. This is a beautiful restaurant but judging from the layout, one never intended to be a buffet. When you first enter and pass the reception counter, you are immediately confronted with a narrow hallway containing the buffet line. After making your way past the buffet and finding a table, you then return to far end of the hallway to get food.

I was at first surprised by the small number of choices, but served myself with what they had before being told that their other selections were in a dark, tiny room across the hall from the buffet line. Actually dark; in that little room we were barely able to tell one dish from another. Had I known about the little room from the beginning, my choices would have been quite different. 

The food was fine: some items better than average; some less so. They don't keep most of the food covered, so several dishes in the hallway that should have been hot were barely warm. If you know anything about food safety, that's a little disquieting. 

Our exit from the restaurant was equally strange. We don't usually wait for a check at buffets: leave a tip on the table, and pay the bill on the way out. That nice big reception desk with a manager and a computer seemed the obvious place to pay. Not so. With marked irritation, the manager directed us to yet another tiny cubbyhole used for payment purposes. 

Recommendation: If you eat here, see what's in the little dark room before taking any food and when you're done, wait for a check. Or just eat someplace else.
author: James V.

description: My favorite go-to place for Indian food!! We went here for their lunch buffet which was only $10! The decor was so classy with white tablecloths, roses at each table, and windows that had the sun shining beautifully through. The buffet isn't just the standard jenky-looking platters sitting under heat lamps, but each food item is kept hot inside big metal cauldrons/pots (so cool). The waiters were also very attentive and were quick to refill your drinks and pick up your used plates. I HIGHLY recommend this place for quality Indian food with unbeatable value, while still maintaining a nice restaurant environment.
author: Andrew T.

description:
This rating is based solely on the Lunch buffet. Upon settling a location for lunch among coworkers, we decided on India Clay Oven. 

The décor had a nice touch with a single rose on table, and luckily we had a good amount of sun shining through the windows that adds to the warm feeling of the place.

The buffet had a nice variety of selection at the time, but we had to flag down the servers to refill some items that were low and to get our naan. The food was mediocre and didn't really stand out. The food tasted Americanized e.g. not as spicy or flavored but still satisfied us at a decent price.
author: Casey L.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here looking for some good Indian food and couldn't decide what to get so we settled on the Clay Oven Thali Dinner for 2. It was AMAZING!! 

It came with Tandoori Chicken, Boti Kabab, Saag Paneer, Papadam, Rice, Nan, Raita, Kheer, Veggie Samosa and Chicken Tikka Masala. We were stuffed and also had plenty of left overs. It was soooo good and everything came out in a timely manner, the waiters were good, and for how much food we got I didn't think it was too pricey.

Definitely coming back!!
author: Heather B.

description:
Love their $10 lunch buffet. The selection rotates a bit, but you generally have a choice of grilled chicken, marinated lamb, chicken curry, salad, basmati rice, and variety of vegetable-based dishes, sides of various chutneys and naan. For dessert they offer coconut ice cream, honey cake balls (not sure of the name), and chai tea.

I like this particular location because it's so bright, and has never been crowded when I've been there. The meal is inexpensive, but the ambiance (cloth napkins, silverware, etc.) makes it a little more formal. Clay Oven is a great place to introduce friends and family to Indian food because their buffet makes it easy to try new dishes. It's cookie cutter, but the food is good and it's a great value.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Yummy Indian food delivered fast, the free, fast part is a bonus.

India Clay Oven is a good value. We got the Rogan Josh and the Coconut Lamb. Both were delicious, but be warned if you ask for it spicy it will come mouth searingly hot! 

Try the naan with goat cheese.
author: Monarch B.

description: Without reservations and on a Saturday night, this restaurant was able to accommodate our party of seven. The staff were all most gracious, the food was quite good- I loved their version of chicken korma!  The corkage fee is quite minimal which was wonderful as we brought in 3 bottles of champagne ( we were celebrating a wedding anniversary). Our dessert was comped which was so kind.  I look forward to my return visit to India Clay Oven!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Indian Shlock today,most of the bowls were 3/4 empty, everything was old.
what happened?  one star.
author: Bert K.

description:
This place used to be better... this should really be more like a 1.5 stars, and not 2.

1. Food. We ordered mixed grill and lamb tikka masala; all lamb was overcooked almost to the point of what you might call "lamb jerky", which is a big disappointment because without well-prepared lamb at a place like this, what's left? Yes, garlic naan and masala sauce were good, but that doesn't make up for the shortfall of the main course.

2. Service. This was the most annoying part. I like to eat my food unsupervised, because I no longer need a high chair and a bib. However, the waiter apparently felt the need to constantly pace up and down the aisles and gawk at the tables, with no real purpose at all... other than trying to pick up every empty dish the moment it was no longer needed. What's ironic is that as many times as he approached our table, not once did he ask how we liked the food... bizarre. This was also around 9 pm on a slow Friday night when this kind of zeal was totally unnecessary; by the time we were finished, we were the only patrons in the whole restaurant. 

I must say that I have had similar experiences with service at Indian restaurants before, but was reluctant to generalize... but now I'm almost thinking this wasn't a simple coincidence.

3. Ambience. I realize this is an ethnic food restaurant, but I would have liked the music to be turned down lower as in large quantities traditional Indian vocals can get pretty tedious when the music is set to the volume of a normal conversation...
author: M B.

description:
The food and management here are amazing. My family has been coming to India Clay Oven for years and love every experience. Whether we come for their delicious lunch buffet (where you get a taste of everything, this has opened my eyes to new dishes I previously was not adventurous enough to try by itself), or the dinner menu, you can't go wrong. 
Our favorite dishes include the chicken makhani and lamb vindaloo (with onion kulcha) or the lamb hyderabadi. All of their dishes are tasty and get the right amount of spice. They also know how to take care of their customers. I'd recommend this restaurant to everyone.
author: Brahm H.

description: Food/service/cleanliness - TERRIBLE!! I would not go there again even if someone held a gun on my head.
author: Naresh T.

description:
Easily the best Chicken Tikka Masala in the City, maybe even the whole Bay Area. Great Samosas. They also have Kashmiri Nan bread which has cherries in it. Phenomenal!
I eat here a lot but I always seem to order the same dishes, sorry :-(
You can always get a seat here :-)
author: Conor L.

description: My cousin and I ordered food to pick up. When we arrived the food was not ready yet but we were brought delicious tea. I ordered the Matar Paneer and it was very good, a little spicy, but toned down well with the rice. My cousin ordered the Palak Dal and it was delicious as well. We ordered some flavored naan and rice that paired perfect. My first time coming here but will not be my last!
author: Katie L.

description:
Good food--nicely seasoned and spicy.  Love their rice!  Nice sit down place for Indian.  Great service.  

But it is on the pricey side for Indian, but they actually have tableside service!  But there are plenty of ads/coupons for this chain.  I prefer this location.
author: Fannie S.

description:
We both love Indian food, and since we live a short walking distance away we had to have a meal here.

When we arrived we were surprised by how empty the restaurant was. The atmosphere is very pretty and elegant, and the staff was friendly and kept are glasses of water filled.

We ordered the chicken tikka masala, rice, keema naan, and regular naan. The chicken tikka sauce was way cheesier than at any other place we've been too. The taste was a bit too much for us, but it wasn't horrible. The keema naan was underwhelming, and barely had any lamb. The rice and regular naan were standard in terms of taste.

The food here is okay, we might come back to try some other items off the menu, and if we do come back it will mostly be due only to proximity to us.
author: Sami R.

description:
Amazing. Wow. I actually just ate there a few hours ago, and I *had* to write a review as soon as I got home. I've been on Yelp for years and use it a lot for finding places, but I slack way off when it comes to writing reviews myself. ICO deserves an awesome review. 

I was referred here by the folks at Trad'r Sam's, a bar just a block away. They told me it was "a bit pricey," but I'd rather pay for good food than spend less on crap. 

The look of the place impressed me as soon as I saw it. Dark wood, white tablecloths, red roses on each table, penguin-suited waiters. I did get a tad nervous about the prices at that point, but my fears were allayed as soon as I got the menu. Their prices are exactly what I'm used to paying (and in several cases, a buck or two cheaper). 

Service was the best I've ever had in any Indian restaurant, hands down. And everything I had was soooo good. I got the onion fritters (they're not listed as pakoras on the menu, but they pretty much are). Coconut chicken curry, one of my favorites -- awesome. It could've used a tad more spice (I ordered it medium), but it certainly wasn't enough to merit the loss of a star. At least the chicken pieces were small and mostly white meat. You know how they are at other restaurants. They brought me a papadum and I ordered garlic naan and rice (yeah, rice doesn't come automatically with entrees). 

I went to wash up after dinner & my check was on the table. I cocked an eyebrow at a $2.00 charge for raita I didn't order. Without hesitation, they took it off the check. Oh, and they even gave me complimentary rice pudding for dessert! It was good, but awfully sweet. I couldn't finish it, but I'm still impressed they offered. 

Then, after a looooooong ride home to Alameda, I realized I was missing some rings. I knew I had to have left them in the bathroom when I took them off to wash my hands, and I knew they had to be either here or Sam's, so I called ICO and before I could even ask, they said "you left three rings here. You can pick them up anytime." 

It was the cleanest, most professionally-staffed Indian restaurant I've ever been to without a doubt. Also the best Indian I've had since I moved to SF 2 months ago. Beyond my wildest expectations for Indian food. I *really* wish it were closer!
author: Emilie E.

description: You really can't beat $10 for an Indian lunch buffet that comes with a fresh basket of naan and a wait staff that's attentive in replenishing your water. And if you think about it, when does a buffet use linen cloth and napkin for the overall place setting? Some offerings from the buffet line are chicken tandoori, lamb curry, fish and vegetable pakora, gulab jamun and kheer. There are also no discernible differences in service or food with their sister location, Indian Clay Oven, on Clement Street. Both places play lively Indian music.
author: Cliff W.

description: I wasn't a fan of Indian food until I came here. The atmosphere is amazing, service is the best. Food quality is spot on everytime. I'm addicted to this place and can't get enough. I have to order atleast once a week. This Clement locations always impressed me. They go above and beyond service. I can always count of them for taking care of their costumers. The chicken tikka masala is amazing, rice pilav and garlic nan is the best. Was even given complementary rice pudding which was amazing and even some sort of coffee/hot chocolate while I waited on my to go order. Highly recommend! Best in SF area!
author: Krista R.

description: Very distasteful food. Not even worth half of the money charged. They didnt even have the heater on in the cold night.
author: Suresh P.

description:
While I could have easily overstuffed myself for the price, I practiced restraint. For once.

The ambiance was wonderful: Lots of natural light from the high windows. Red interior. The decor felt elegant, although the food was dive-ish.

I was disappointed that it wasn't Indian spicy. This is the place to go for Americanized Indian food and it hits the spot.
author: Ruiqiu K.

description:
My house and I are frequent visitors for India Clay Oven,  my sister Sydney and Adam introduced me to the delicious world of Tiki Masala. mmmmmm  This chicken allergy also kicks my butt from time to time but prawn Tiki Masala is a craving I have at least once a week.  

The service is always very attentive and I ordered one time at 11pm for delivery and they took my order for a late night delivery!  

Not really a fan of peas but there always so delicious on top of the cute little buckets of basmati, the regular, garlic, cheese nan is consistently delicious.

I forget sometimes the places that we frequently visit need their yelp review as well.  mmmm Clay Oven always delivers delicious Indian food and a quick fix on that craving for danceable Bollywood music.

My sister loves the keer which is version of rice pudding that always cleanses the pallet of all the Delicious spices.
author: Grace T.

description:
So I cant review with full honesty for this restaurant due to a mix up in what was ordered, whoever I can say the food wasn't bad. 

Im one lazy foodie, I ordered for delivery on the website for the restaurant and had the food delivered to my apartment. The delivery went off with out a hitch. But the order was wrong... this wasn't anyone's fault though. The website links to choose the food you would like delivered is linked up wrong. So what I thought was going to be Chana Aloo turned out to be Aloo Mutter. 

None the less I ate what was delivered and was oddly surprised. I hate peas in most foods but the Aloo Mutter was tasty enough for me to enjoy not just the day it was delivered but the next day as well. My sister loved the Vegetable Samosa which were quick to be inhaled. 

The only thing that I dont much like was the amount of grease the food had. It far from impossible to make Indian food without the heavy layer of oil on top, but like most restaurants its not a priority. (Id know Its not impossible considering on my non-lazy days I make Indian food at home.) If they had cut down on the grease and fixed the website it would have surely gained them at least another star. 

Over all not a bad place to eat if your not counting calories and arent too picky about whats delivered (if you're doing delivery that is) ...
author: Saumita P.

description: Update: day after I wrote this review I got a very nice phone call from the owner, apologizing for the misunderstanding (kind of awesome when a restaurant reads reviews so frequently.) I haven't taken him up on his offer for a complimentary dinner yet but both my husband and I feel a lot better and much more comfortable with calling these guys up again.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Definitely my favorite Indian food in the neighborhood.  Even living in Sunset me and my boyfriend would stop by to get some of their delicious Tikka Masala. Since we don't eat meat, we would order it with paneer instead of chicken, and it would always come with a bunch of biiig cubes of it. mmm, yum!!! Lunch buffet is always nice, too! I only wish they would change it up a little more, but fish pakoras, saag paneer and fresh warm gulab jamun for desert are to die for!!! Last time we asked the owner when they gonna have paneer tikka masala on the buffet menu, as a vegetarian choice. He was so nice that he's made it specifically for us and didn't add it to the bill!!! 
And one more thing - try their kashmiri salmon! absolutely delicious!!!
And, they have delivery, too! 
5 stars, keep coming back and never had a complaint!
author: Lisa M.

description:
Nope. Not good. I ordered a Saag Paneer and two plain naans for dinner last night. 

First thing that happened was the guy who took my order over the phone said, "That's it?!"

"Yep," I said cheerily and not rudely, not wanting saliva spicing my food. Perhaps I should've said something about I'm eating ALONE and there's no way I could finish more food than what I just ordered.

"Just saag paneer and two naans? Nothing else?"

"Nope, just that."

"No rice?"

"Nope. I use the naan to dip."

"No drinks or desserts?"

"Nope. Just the saag paneer and the naan please." 

I picked up my food ten minutes later, brought it home, opened the container and saw....no spinach. What happened to the spinach? The cheese cubes were there, but where was the spinach? 

The naan was good, but it didn't taste like it was baked in a tandoori oven; rather, it was just the slightest bit oily and seemed like it was pan fried. 

I wound up not eating the "saag paneer" and ate the naan instead. What a disappointing dinner. 

I won't be back.
author: Evelyn C.

description: Im not a huge fan of Indian food but they have some really good dishes nonetheless
author: Tiffany R.

description:
Ate at the Oven with a friend and simply put, liked the place. The place has neat decor with good table service. We were promptly seated and appreciated the attention :). Its nice to know when a business is 'really' interested in your business.
We ordered the usual suspects, lamb biryani (rice slow cooked with spices). Although the rice was a little over done and may not have been as slow cooked as we'd have liked it, but hey this is not my grand ma's kitchen and we are in the 21st century!!!

The chicken curry - if I recall was butter chicken was good and went well with the butter naan - true to the Punjab tradition.

Overall a nice experience, good food, attentive service, clean and yes, reasonable.

The only caveat - parking is a hellish experience (although we were lucky to find a spot in front of the restaurant that is validated). So plan ahead, give yourself time and make sure to have no growling tummies in the car!
author: Abe K.

description:
A good friend and I have been trying various Indian buffets through out the city, and came across this gem last week. From outside it looks pretty damn fancy, and we walked in, and it was a bit fancy...Roses on the table? For a lunch buffet? Whoa.

It's got a GREAT selection for the price, lots of vegetarian options as well. After 3 plates, and 2 rounds of dessert-  I knew I had to call it quits.

The servers are creepily attentive and pretty friendly- even if they make fun of me for eating 3 plates of food. 

I can't help it that I like tikka massala so much...
author: Lauren S.

description:
All you can eat lunch buffet. A little pricier than the place we used to frequent on Geary but the food was good. 

I love the dining area but think it would get VERY hot in there on a nice day.

The chicken makahni was very tasty and paired with the naan bread was delish. Their rice pilav was very disappointing b/c it seemed to have been sitting there a long time. Very hard and dry. I would have preferred just regular steamed rice. The vegetable pakoras were also very disappointing b/c they also appeared to have been there awhile and were very doughy instead of more vegetables to it. There was also a vegetable dish that was very good.

I don't crave Indian food too often, so I think it was fulfilled until next time.
author: Dina V.

description:
For the price, it's a decent meal. For me, what set it apart from the average mid-range Indian restaurants are the Hyderabad dishes (they come in chicken, lamb, maybe other meats). These are an excellent mix of tastes and textures: the sauce includes chewy sliced dried apricots and crunchy slivered almonds, in addition to the usual Indian flavors. If you prefer moderately sweet desserts, this dish could scratch that itch, too. 

I think the rest of the food is three stars. It's a nice place for a cheap lunch in a sun-drenched dining room. And there are times when I have eaten here simply because of the dedicated parking spaces out front--a detail worth remembering if you are headed to this neighborhood.
author: Nat C.

description:
Went here on a whim but won't go back.  Decor and setting are nice, food is decent (but Bombay Gardens in San Mateo is clearly better), service was poor.

I found two gristly bone ends in my moderate sized portion of chicken curry (from the buffet), so the kitchen wasn't being very attentive to prep work.  It took them 10 minutes to bring our naan, and while I was eating a 2nd helping of food from the buffet, the waiter reached over my plate and across my face to pick up the first plate, even though there was plenty of room to go behind me (the next table was empty).  That reflects either utter lack of concern for customers, or terrible training.
author: Eli Y.

description: This short review is for a recent take-out experience.  When we saw the final bill and then saw the food that arrived were pretty shocked how little there was.  The portions were very small, and a couple of the dishes were terrible.  The Chicken Tikka Masala was good, but not up to the raves I saw in a review or two.  Upshot: given all the options for Indian in the City, this is a mediocre choice at best and extremely overpriced.
author: Doug O.

description: I came here once a upon a time when it was still at that dinky little place across the street that smelled like cat urine...lovely I know right! So fast forward and many many many years later...this place is much nicer looking now. My sister and I were craving indian curry for some reason and it rarely happens that's for sure so we decided to give this lunch buffet a shot. I was pleasantly surprise that it was not bad for the price of $8.45. I felt like I was able to eat the salad with the yogurt dressing all day with the side of their lamb curry. LOL that was pretty much all that I ate there.....I love yogurt dressing. Also, I was able to round off my meal with Kheer..lovely sweet rice dessert! I could see myself coming back for my indian fix the next time!
author: Allison T.

description: This place is great!! My roommates and I love this place and go often :) all the foods amazing I love love the rice pudding this is a must try
author: Veronica V.

description: Good buffet for $10. Great tikki masala. Sag paneer just ok. A lamb dish would've been nice. Wait for the fresh naan to table vs those sitting at the buffet. Everything else was pretty good and not overly spicy. 4 yr old was half price, 2 yr old free. My bro said the San Mateo location is better now tho. Options thinned out by 2pm as buffet ends at 2:30pm (weekend at least).
author: Kevin W.

description: Amazingness! Food, price, everything.. Couldn't be better. Came here with a big group and again with just 2 of us- both times, fantastic! New favorite place
author: Dana S.

description:
i like their lunch time buffet, its decently priced and pretty good.

i came with my sister and her boyfriend, we started off with some fried vegetables, curry chicken, chicken tikka masala, and curry vegetables. i love the flavors for all the dishes its all very rich. you can taste the chicken but at the same time you can taste the spices and its kind of spicy but not too spicy. im also a fan of their rice pudding, its so delicious! their mango lassi is also very good.
author: Stella J.

description:
Some of the best Indian food.  Period!
We've been going here for years and it remains the best Indian restaurant on our list of favorites.
We've had many of the chicken and vegetarian dishes - all super tasty.
My husband and our friends are fans of the Saturday buffet.  I can't often partake in that due to some dietary restrictions, however, I don't feel like I'm missing out.  I'm in love with their Kashmiri Naan.  I think I could eat this daily for the rest of my life and life would be good!
author: Rena U.

description:
I have tried buffets at many Indian restaurants in the Bay Area. Food at this one is just around or somewhat below average -- some of their dishes were even COLD instead of being kept warm. In my opinion, only makhani chicken was really tasteful. The big plates ready for use were not clean that one could obviously see some residues not washed off.
